Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: We requested a fridge in our first room, which took them forever to bring. When they did bring it it reeked of rotten fish. So we called and asked for another one. We waited an hour for it then left to go to a concert. Six hours later when we returned we still had not got one and the nasty one was still there causing our whole room to smell awful. They switched us rooms and gave us another fridge which did not work at all. This rooms shower was broke, as were the phones unless you put it on speaker. The sheets were stained and we also found reeses wrappers in the bed that night when neither of us had eaten reeses. THe mini bar had someone elses old shrimp cocktail and leftovers in it. We did not even bother to complain about this stuff because everytime we tried to say something about anything they were rude and took at least an hour to get anything done. Our room temp alternated between insanely hot to insanely cold, back and forth, even though we kept it on fifty. Awful place. Will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Melinda18550
Reviews.Content: Other than this hotel carrying the Westin name, it is a second rate facility. It appeared tired, slightly dirty and the room was small, dark and uninspired --even by chain hotel standards. My key wasn't coded, the bathroom toilet had a loud dripping sound all night long, the room was hot and stuffy, and, I didn't receive a newspaper in the morning despite repeated requests. My recommendation is to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay based on the price.”
Reviews.Author: cprussel
Reviews.Content: I am basing this review on the price $120 after taxes which I feel was very good for the date we stayed and the location of the hotel. This does not include the cost of parking (hotel garage $32) and any other incidentals. Watch out for the $4.00 bottle of water. It is on a pressure plate. One move of the bottle and you are billed. Thankfully we were tipped off about this from another reviewer and we did not have an issue. The hotel is within walking distance to about everything downtown. We were in town for the Big Ten tournament. It was about a 10 minute walk to Bankers life field house which was great. This hotel is home base for Michigan State fans it seems although other some other fans were present. Overall the hotel seemed better than the last time I stayed here. The room we had was in nice condition and for the two of us plenty big. Bathroom is very small, room for one person at a time. Overall the front desk staff was good. The gentleman that helped check us in seemed a little burned out. All other requests during our stay were granted and timely. Pool is subpar for this class of hotel . Very small, the times we visited the kids using it seemed to enjoy it none the less. The main complaint I have with this hotel is the parking. You must valet your car at this hotel and in order to get your car you must wait on valet to bring it up. During busy times plan on waiting a good 15 – 30 minutes to get your car. Please plan accordingly. The nice thing is you should not need your car if your activities are all downtown due to the nice downtown location of the hotel. This is really more the norm for most if not all downtown hotels. Plenty of options exist in the area if you need other parking. In summary if I would have had to pay more for this hotel my review may have been more critical. Since the price was so fair I give this hotel a 4 star for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: This Westin Hotel is in the center of fine restaurants, the convention center and Lucas Field. The room was small, efficient and quiet. Access to the rooms is with your room key in the key slot in the elevator, not very convenient when you have items in your hands. The standard-size beds are small and not as comfortable as advertised...opt for the KS room. Westin has a member's point bonus program where you get an extra 500 points if you skip having your room cleaned, bed made and fresh towels everyday...questionable value. Great wine bar at the Conrad Hotel, two blocks from the Westin...wines from all over the world, decent pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Works well”
Reviews.Author: BillParker
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with enclosed walking bridge to convention center. Upgrade for Platinum member was not available and room I received was quite worn and dated. Still I would stay here again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time to stay in a Westin.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker27and1
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am a Starwood loyalist. I am a seasoned traveler. I stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago and hoped the bad experience might soften before I wrote the review. But whenever I think of that hotel, I think about my lovely relaxing get away from New York, as ruined by this experience. I went the weekend AFTER the SuperBowl, so you would think Westin property a few blocks from the stadium would have it's act together. Also the fact that this is a HUGE convention hotel. OK, convention hotels are not always the swankiest, but usually very service oriented. This one gets zero circles for service. First I had a rental car. When I pulled up at about 11 p.m., there was no valet/bellman/doorman who came out. I waited awhile and even honked my horn. It was a snowy night and I was nursing a broken ankle. After about 10 minutes, I had no choice but to lock up the care and hobble in. They said they only had one bellman on duty and he was helping someone else. One guy at the front desk also helping someone else. I was given a room with a burned out light in the bathroom. So I called downstairs. They couldn't tell me when maintainence would come up, so I asked if I could just change rooms, since I hadn't even unzipped my suitcase. So it took a while, but they come up with a key for a new room and floor. It was fine. As I started unpacking, I heard a lot of noise in the hallway. I waited about 15 minutes and it seemed to grow more. It was now midnight. I opened the door and I saw kids sitting in the hallway and drinking...show no signs of leaving. I said how much longer are you going to be out there, and they just looked at me. I called downstairs and asked if they could intervene. They said, Well a fraternity has booked the hotel, so there is not much we can do. I said, OK, do you have any floors without a fraternity party going on? They said they would move me. So I waited. and waited. I called down and they said the bellman was on his way. He never came after about 15 minutes. Back downstairs and the poor front desk guy, still alone, helping others. At this point, I am distraught. Bad ankle, tired from a long flight, and hungry. He put me in a room he said "where the pilots and flight attendants stay." The poor alone bellman tries to help me move. He was very sweet, but I said, it seems only three people are working tonight, you, the front desk, and the guy on the phone. And he said, pretty much. I couldn't believe it...the hotel is huge and they were nearly booked as it was the weekend before Valentine's Day. I got to the room, it was fine, no view, but it was quiet. I unpacked and called room service, nearly 1 a.m. now (wasted all this time getting to a decent, quiet room). They only had a few items to offer...nothing hot. And really cheap wines (well, I could see I am not at the W!). I asked how long it would take and they said 45 minutes. So it would be nearing 2 a.m.. It was near 0 outside, so they sent me to the attached restaurant, which was nice enough,and they were closing up, but took pity on me and had some bar food which was hot which I carried up to my room (very glamorous!) I then went to take a shower and the "heavenly shower heads"...only one worked so it was not so heavenly. The bathroom was smaller than most in New York and the lighting was very dim. The towels were super thin (definitely not heavenly), and there were only one bath towel! Then went to sleep in the so-called heavenly beds, which felt just like any old hotel bed. Nothing special about the linens either. The next morning, I went to use the phone by the bed, and it did not work. Had to get up and go over to the desk. I called down to ask for a manager to share my experience and see if I could get these items fixed while I went out for the day. They said they don't have a manager until 1. I said ok, can I leave a message for him? I was doubtful that they took the message, I went to the front desk on my way out (there is no concierge at this hotel)....again waiting in line, although there were now 2 people at the front desk. I told my person a little bit of my story, and she was very rude. I left my number again with her for the manager to call me on my mobile So, the entire day, no one called me. I got back to the room thinking there was a message, and again,none. The shower was not fixed, nor was the phone. The sheets were not changed. Even though I put the little card on the bed that said "change the sheets." When I left the hotel, I will say there were a few more people at the bell/valet stand than at night. But when I stop to ask them for the best directions to the location (only about 7 miles!), it was if I had asked them how to get to Memphis. They totally could not give me directions...didn't seem to know the streets at all. Very odd. They asked if I wanted to talk to a manager, and I just laughed and left, using my Google map on my cell phone...difficult to use as the roads were slick. When I returned late at night, I experienced the same problem with no bellman/valet. Had to turn the car off and come in. Same thing at the front desk...one lone guy. Well only one more night of this. When I checked out I stopped by the front desk just to be sure they had my entire bill, including valet (which incidentally they did not as I was charged for that a few days later). Again a very cold staff at the reception desk. This is not the Indy I remembered. I finally said, are you interested in my Westin experience at your hotel? The woman seemed a little shocked. She asked if I wanted to speak with a manager. I said yes, but it would have been nice to have someone to talk to DURING my stay, not as I am checking out. I left my cell phone number if they were interested in my experience. I will tell all who read this review to beware of this hotel. It really gave me a poor view of downtown Indianapolis after all the hype. As far as staying in a Westin...never. To all who may be forced to stay here, just know this is a very old property with some renovation in public areas. The rooms are clean enough, but very dated. Bathroom is so dimly lit, you need to put on your makeup in the bedroom (so bring some extensionn cords). In terms of my rating, if there were an option for no circles, that would no circles too many.

Reviews.Title: “good location in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0632
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overall. Was there on business. Careful with mini fridge/bottled water. If you pick up the bottled water they will charge you. Staff was friendly and helpful.The hotel is well connected to the convention center as well as overhead sky bridges which lets you access a whole bunch of stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Downtown Indianapolis: Thanks John at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: A O
Reviews.Content: Hi, this is a great hotel. John at the Front Desk provided great service to our family (We parked in the wrong garage, he fixed that; we needed a larger room, he found us a suite with a view). I couldn't find my Starwood number, he let me stay in the line anyway:). The room was fabulous; soft beds; very nice lobby. Also, it was my first time using hotwire and the rate was fabulous. It was an emergency trip & I only booked 3 hours before arriving. I know technology provides integrated systems between all providers, but there are many horror stories about rates not being honored or other snafus. This wasn't the case. Tip: Our Navigation system didn't have the correct directions once we got to downtown Indy. We went around the 'very long block' a few times before finally finding the street that led us to the Westin. Everything else was fab: Thanks John at FD. Thanks: A.O. from chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was like sleeping on a cloud.”
Reviews.Author: Flybynight21122012
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet room. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Special kudo's to "John" who checked us in. His knowledge and strategies of parking and dining kept our visit within budget.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay at the Westin Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: This is the2nd year for me staying at the Westin Indianapolis. My foundation stays at the Westin for the Motorcycle Dealers Show. The Westin is a great hotel and has a walkway to the Convention Center. We have always found the Westin staff to be very professional and try to meet all our needs.There are great restaurants within walking distance and you can take the "gerbil Trail" (walkways) to local restaurants and a shopping mall within 3 blocks. Great overall experience and I know that our Foundation will use the Westin again next year

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: It is a clean and modern hotel with comfortable bed. The room was wide, as anywhere else in North America. The cleanliness was very good. The location is good with many restaurants & shops around. A little bit on the luxury side, but the price is also on expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room Good/Front Desk Staff Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: KatieLaGrange
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Westin before and enjoyed it. I like the rooms, I like the restaurant on site. I like the proximity to the convention center. I don't like the way the staff at the front desk treats you. We were there for a cheer competition and it was very busy - so I can cut them a bit of slack. But if you are not cut out for being able to handle busy - you may need to continue your hotel career in a hotel that is not busy. The problem I had was that when I checked in they held my entire 2 day stay on my check card. I was told it would be one night not the entire bill plus the $50.00 incidentals. I went down to switch my card and the girl said it may take until Monday for the funds to be released or Tuesday since Monday was a holiday. It took until the following FRIDAY TO RELEASE MY MONEY!! This was a check card not a credit card. This happened to several of our folks. The front desk seemed to shrug this off like "not my problem". I am not just a "CHEER MOM" I travel a ton and actually plan events for my company and I like to be treated like a Gold Club member not an inconvienence.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Quality”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: Some hotels, such as the Hilton, offer no actual consistency in quality. They are a brand once known for their quality and have degraded into franchisees that take pride and put money back into the property, or do not. The Westin must have better regulations for their franchisees because in general they have a very uniform code of cleanliness, impeccable and modern rooms, helpful staff, and unsurpassed service. This was no different! I err on the side of caution with hotels but this time I can truly give an unsurpassed seal of approval!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... in high style!”
Reviews.Author: jp_edwards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin to be close to the Madame Walker Theater. The location rocks ... the hotel is all dressed up for the Super Bowl and it is connected to the convention center and the Circle Center Mall. I didn't try the food here but the pool and workout area is fantastic. It's usually pretty pricey but I got it on Priceline for less than half price. The beds were perfect and the dual head shower made me rethink our bathroom design at home.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: My expierience was great before I even arrived with attention to detail I did not expect. When I did arrive at the Westin I was running late and found the front desk to be friendly and accomodating as I needed to be at the Premiere of a movie and was late. John Rabold went into action and made me feel very calm by taking control and speeding up my process moving me to another room with a better view that I could get in right then and now. I found out John was the front desk supervisor, and that made sense as his staff rallied behind him like the true professionals they are. They struck up a conversation and made me feel at home before I had even arrived at my room. They hand delivered me a card signed by the staff welcoming me to the hotel. This is the kind of personal service that has been forgotten in many hotels in my travels.I went up to my room and was so impressed with the view of downtown Indianapolis and the room was beautiful. I could see from my room I was close to everywhere I needed to go and after I dropped of a bag I went down to the lobby and once again the front desk staff was the best. I asked about parking and they explained my options. I asked about directions and they were like a human Garmin. They did all this with a smile on their face. If I thought Siri in my Iphone was helpful, these people put her to shame. I returned to the hotel late and stayed up very late to enjoy the view and the comfort of the room. I slept so well in the comfortaqble bed and luxurious comforter that I over slept and once again the front desk came to the rescue. I could say everyone from the valet parkers, to the front desk made my stay at the Westin one I will repeat. In a competitive world the Westin goes above and beyond the call of duty. See you again soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: eggnelle
Reviews.Content: I am loyal to the Starwood brands, love their properties. The Westin Indianapolis is no exception. Beautiful hotel, great rooms, and great staff. A big thanks to John Rabold for is incredible customer service! I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Unsurpassed Service - You Need to Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: NaptownRadioGirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years but am finally writing a well-deserved and long overdue review. I was attending the Premiere of a film called, "Naptown Rock Radio Wars". The staff, particularly the front desk supervisor, John Rabold, was extremely professional, friendly and accommodating to my need for a late check in, holding my luggage, making sure everything was the way I wanted it. The rooms were VERY nice. I couldn't have been happier! And the beds.....aren't they called 'Heavenly Beds?" Yes...they are! The location downtown was fantastic. Close to everything. Anyone coming here for the Super Bowl should put the Westin at the top of your list! There's a great restaurant (Shula's) inside the Westin. If you're looking for a GREAT NEIGHBORHOOD Pub that's casual- right next door is Loughmiller's (pronounced lock-miller's) Pub & Eatery. Great food, friendly staff, excellent drinks, fun atmosphere. You get the best of everything when you stay at the Westin. Can you tell I had a good time? *******Thanks everyone!*******

Reviews.Title: “Updated upgraded downtown Westin”
Reviews.Author: f1orchid
Reviews.Content: This Westin recently went through some renovations and upgrades. Most notably the lobby got a make over with new interior design. The rooms are the same but in great quality shape. The upgrade has come in two areas. Finally they fixed their wireless internet which was horrendous in the past, now works like likely split. Additionally the front desk service is much improved with agent John Rabold on hand. He assigned me a great room location. The hotel still needs more accessible power outlets for the business traveller in each room rather than a crawl under the desk for only one open plug in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a magnificent view of the city and is just a few blocks from everything in downtown Indy. The staff was extremely helpful. In particular I want to single out John Rabold who checked us in, learned of our plans and made very helpful recommendations about our evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh new lobby do the rooms next”
Reviews.Author: careyhc
Reviews.Content: Stable Westin with outstanding service, wonderful shower and heavenly beds. Rooms are beginning I to look dated especially the carpet but you cannot go wrong with the location across from the convention center and only a shortwalk to numerous restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Not the best by a long shot”
Reviews.Author: Nigel1970
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice in the last year- first time was decent despite problems with keys repeatedly not working- this time was another matter- We showed up at 5pm and the hotel was pretty full- despite requesting one king we were given two doubles in a room that was tiny- it hink it used to have one queen and that would have been ok- the bathroom was old and needed a major overhaul- the shower heads only partially worked, some of the jets were clogged and the closet was so small it was barely usable- the fitness center is great- no complaints there- except for a fairly pervasive odor- like mildew covered with industrial cleaner that was present on the 3rd floor leading to the gym and the second floor all the way into the upscale restaurant. The staff was helpful- sort of- I wanted a town car for the ride to the airport and there was serious confusion about arranging that- they kept trying to put us in a taxi- overall, next year maybe the Marriot or the Hyatt that are both right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for New Years stay”
Reviews.Author: kbass0001
Reviews.Content: Overall, very pleased with our stay. Great location in the heart of downtown near the Wholesale District. Located within walking distance to several restaurants, Circle Center mall, night life... The hotel was very modern and enjoyed our weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is wonderful...Everything else is honestly a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ZMAN3411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and friends for a Sports Weekend (College Basketball Saturday, Colts-Titans game Sunday). We have stayed at a few different hotels in downtown Indianapolis and all four of us agreed- this was our least favorite. Positives: 1) The Lobby is very welcoming with a Starbucks, Shula's Steakhouse, and nice decor. 2) The location is great- walking distance from anything you want to go to downtown! Negatives: 1) There is an additional cost for EVERYTHING...Be careful not to touch the water bottles in the room, mini fridge, etc.- it will show up on your bill. 2) Parking cost is outrageous...I recommend parking off site at the Government building around the block! 3) Hallways and rooms need renovations! Though the lobby looks very nice, the hallways and rooms make you wonder if you are really at a Westin. I must tell you that this review is coming from someone that is not very picky...This is actually my first review that I am not labeling as "Excellent" (5 Stars). If I paid $70 or less for a room here- I would say it is Average to Above Average...but since I paid a price for a Westin room- it is well below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ops79
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on my way to Chicago for Christmas. The hotel is beautiful! It looks recently renovated. My room was super clean, the carpets looked brand new, and all of the staff was great. It is really close to shopping and restaurants. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior help in an emergency”
Reviews.Author: Margaret611943
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for a conference at the Indianapolis Convention Center. The Westin is the most convenient of the 3 hotels attached to the Convention Center. We enjoyed the hotel and everything there is very nice, but were most impressed when one of our friends became ill during a meeting. General Manager Dale McCarty responded immediately when I requested help. Dale and his staff quickly brought a roll away bed to an adjoining room, towels and water for compresses. They checked back frequently and had a staff person check vitals. After an hour our friend agreed to let EMS be called and Dale took care of that. We had planned to check out at noon, but when we needed to go to the hospital with our friend, Dale took care of holding our room at no charge until we were able to return. Thankfully, a potentially scary situation ended well, in no small part to Dale and the staff's response to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Maitre d' at 15th Floor Courtesy Bar Fine Example for Entire Staff”
Reviews.Author: Teryl S
Reviews.Content: Darren Fish, the Maitre d' of the 15th Floor's Courtesy Bar, was very professional and genuinely interested in his customers. He is a fine example of the overall professionalism of the entire Westin staff. -Terry R. Smith

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAD1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a conference. The room was very clean and spacious. The hotel is connected via Skywalk to the mall which was very nice as I didn't have to walk on the street at night. Several very nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at Westin Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Elijio L
Reviews.Content: Traveled by car from Atlanta Georgia to Chicago Illinois to visit family for thanksgiving, On my way to Chicago I stopped for a night at the Westin as I was very tired from long hours of driving. From the moment I stepped into The Westin Indianapolis I had a heavenly experience. It was 2am and I was greeted by the Front desk Supervisor John. John treated me with such wonderful Westin-heavenly hospitality. He asked me which type of room I was looking for, even though I did not care what room I was put in because I was very tired he gave me a complimentary upgrade to a King suite which was beautiful. The housekeeping staff sure does know how to clean rooms and everything was fully stocked. I was able to unwind, and refresh my spirit in the Westin signature heavenly king size bed. Upon checkout, I was greeted by lovely front desk agent Dagny. She was very polite and well mannered and full of the Westin spirit. For anyone looking for a heavenly stay at a hotel with energetic staff in the Indianapolis city, I highly recommend "Westin Indianapolis".

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: uwdsr1
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Indianapolis from Chicago as a small getaway/road trip with our young son and while it is a fun and underrated city, this was one of the worst hotel experiences we've had. I am an SPG Gold Member and I've had much better experiences at hotels such as Holiday Inn Express and Hampton Inn, even Comfort Inn. We will definitely return to Indy but we've stayed at the Omni in the past and will likely return there or to one of the other many hotels in the downtown Circle Center area. When we pulled up to the valet, we were not greeted. We removed the luggage ourselves, when the valet finally arrived. He took our key, did not give us a ticket, and then disappeared, and we spend 10 minutes looking for him while bringing our luggage in ourselves. I had booked a club room suite. I was told we'd get a suite and we'd have club access, but we would not be on the club floor. Our keycards did not work and I had to go back down to the front desk to tell the person who checked us in (who was the manager) that we needed new keys. My wife forgot something in the car - 30 MINUTES for them to bring it up to retrieve something. They did remove the valet charge for both nights. The club room is a joke, especially at night. First, when we entered on Friday night, the stench of bad food and trash was so bad we almost had to leave right away. There was a pathetic display of Townhouse crackers and cheese (crackers still in the carton) and veggies, and apples with bad brown spots on the side. The smell was likely coming from the frozen dumplings they had heated up. After I mentioned the smell, the next night, it was gone, but the food was no better. Breakfast was somewhat better, with eggs, potatoes, sausage and oatmeal, as well as cereals, bagels, etc. If you stay here, you'll do as I did and laugh out loud when you realize your reservation uses the phrase "contemporary decor" and then you look at the rooms. The rooms, elevators, and hallways are in need of a major renovation. The decor of the room and hallways is what I'd expect out of an unrenovated Holiday Inn, not out of a Westin, with stains on the sofa, unfinished molding on the ceiling, chipped paint, dents in the elevators, etc. In addition, our room had a sofabed. They gave us one very old-school green wool blanket for it. I asked for an extra comforter and they said "we don't usually keep extras." Really? You have the exact number of comforters for the exact number of beds? What happens in an emergency, such as a spill, etc? Next, a big draw to the hotels in Circle Center is that they are all connected by Skywalk to the mall and to each other, as well as restaurants, etc. This weekend, the Skywalk was closed. However, if you looked on the website beforehand, and clicked on "special conditions exist at this hotel," there is no warning about this. I realize this is out of the hotel's control, but if you are going to have a "special conditions" section, use it. All in all, this was not a good experience and I'd recommend this hotel get its act together, because there is a lot of competition in the area and despite having SPG Gold status, I'd stay anywhere but here when returning to Indianapolis. There even seemed to be something about the heavenly bed that wasn't that heavenly - maybe it was just that the rest of the hotel was so disappointing. As an aside, we HIGHLY recommend the Indianapolis Children's Museum. You could spend all day there with your kids and they will not get bored. It's the largest in the world and it was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Night out”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel with access to all of downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: s w
Reviews.Content: I love this motel and always stay here when I am in Indy. The staff will always go overboard to accomodate you. (Like finding you an umbrella when its raining) :) This is an extremely clean, well maintained motel and the location is excellent. You can use the skywalk to the convention center, the mall and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wellmaintained friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lelou18
Reviews.Content: We were on a conference in the hotel. Very nice and friendly staff. Very professional treatment. clean and cosy despite the vastness. it is connected to other hotels and the mall by a skywalk which make it easyto walkaround from one place to another in cold weather without suffering. good location and nice scenery. Clean, professional and friendly place

Reviews.Title: “Customer Servoce”
Reviews.Author: jkdevoe
Reviews.Content: I got lost in downtown Indianapolis finding the Westin Hotel; when I called the hotel, I was fortunately transfered to Ms. Terri Coleman; she stayed on the phone until I was in the driveway of the Westin. What a help./ Then when I checked in . they went overboard anbd let me have access tro the Priorty Room where Mohamad was so accomadating. I felt very cared for and appreciate the extra service they boyth provided.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ando19446
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with a stay at the Westin Indianapolis in late Oct. 2011. The price was very reasonable (even with the added Internet access fee) and I was pleased about the $5 off food coupon in return for not having the room made up after the first night's stay. The Westin Indianapolis provides very clean, pleasant, and comfortable accomodations and very helpful and friendly staff. I would definitely stay there again on any subsequent business trip to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: efields4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for a weekend get away. The hotel was under some construction at the time (lobby). Be careful with the in room drinks, if you just lift the beverage up they will charge you, even if you don't drink the beverage. The people at the front desk were ok, but I expect more of friendly smile than what I received. Rooms were average at best. Clean for sure. Overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable city stay”
Reviews.Author: EvanL
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room on the 9th floor at The Westin, Indianapolis over a weekend in late October, 2011. The Westin is a higher-end hotel, conveniently located (joined) next to the Indianapolis Convention Center but some parts of the hotel are beginning to show their age. Check-in was relatively fast at the counter. concierge and counter staff were knowledgeable and efficient. The room was clean and well-kept, although it was evidently more than a few years old. The beds came with 5 pillows each and were very soft and comfortable (probably the most comfortable hotel beds) I've slept in), tiny fridge (no room for my stuff other than the snacks or drinks you get charged for using), desk and chairs and flatscreen TV. Bathroom was well-annoited (with the expected shampoo, conditioner, soap, and hairdryer) but was on the small side. The rooms were fairly well soundproofed, which is important as I'm a light sleeper. The gym (with 10 treadmills) was open 24 hrs a day and the heated indoor pool and jacuzzi were open till 10pm. The pool was showing its age - one of the support beams of the ladder was broken. Checkout was a breeze, with a receipt slipped under my door on the day of checkout. There were 2 restaurants on site (plus a Starbucks which closes by 3pm everyday) - Shulla serves expensive steaks. Stay away from their salmon - my colleague and I both came down with diarrhea the next morning after having grilled and blackened salmon. Two issues I had with Westin were: the tag on the bottled water said something like the drink is on us (complimentary) but I was charged $5.32 for it at checkout. And there was a card that said if you don't want your room cleaned (to be green), you can leave a card on your door and receive a $5 voucher at Starbucks, but the next day I received a note that this offer was not available that day. It was OK for a short business stay in Indianapolis and very convenient for meetings at the Convention center.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel has done nothing, but go downhill”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: Stayed there an annual conference October 30-November 1, 2011. Have always enjoyed my experiences in the past but this time, not so much. Although a good size, my room was dark, dingy and in need of repair. The light at the door, that was supposed to light the closet as well, did not work. I went to the front desk three times to report this and they were so busy, I didn't stay. The carpet was frayed and pulling up and the crown molding was incomplete... a really odd sight. The bathroom light was so dim I wasn't even sure what my makeup looked like. the magnifying mirror was a nice touch, but again... not effective in the dim light. . The fitness center was nice...equipment was nice and it was clean and well lit. Room Service was adequate but really overpriced. Having to pay for internet is another offense. Hopefully the conference will be moved to another hotel... I don't want to have to stay at this westin again. It gives the Westin brand a very bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stephen368
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location downtown was perfect and the room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. Nice decor and helpful staff. It was definitely what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/No Big Complaints”
Reviews.Author: produce592
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin from 10/28 - 11/1 after having a horrible and God-awful experience at the Hyatt across the street (see related post). I showed up at the Westin's front desk with no reservations, seeking a three nights' stay. John, a front desk manager in the evenings, was most helpful. He was able to provide accommodations for two nights but told me that he could not promise anything beyond that. He asked me to keep checking back. I did, and he was able to accommodate me for a third night. Thank you, John. The hotel has a spacious lobby. There are six elevators, so there is not usually a long wait for one. My room (1337) was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. There were plenty of clean towels. Many reviewers have noted the small bathrooms. This is true. They are small, but I managed. It was not a problem for me. The tub drained a bit slow, so as you shower, you might be standing in a few inches of water. Internet service is reliable but not free (10.00 a day). There are snacks and bottled water provided on those motion sensitive machines, so if you touch the snacks or the water, even if you don't eat or drink, you will probably be charged for it. It is better to take the Indy Go Green Line Shuttle from the airport for $7.00 one way as opposed to a $20.00 or more cab ride. The shuttle boards at the Zone 6 ground transportation area and stops near most major hotels in the downtown area. The Westin is centrally located. Lucas Oil Stadium, the Indiana Convention Center, and the Circle Centre Mall are all accessible by the sky bridge from the hotel, so you do not have to walk on the city streets if you don't want to. Walking the streets is not bad, however. I never felt unsafe, but it is still good to use common sense to avoid poorly lighted areas, and do not jaywalk. There seems to be a beggar/panhandler on almost every corner, but none seemed aggressive in any way. If you do not wish to be bothered, simply ignore them, and keep walking. My stay was a nice one. Either I am too easy to please, or some travelers are very critical. Probably the slow tub drain and the $10.00 a day Internet charges caused the most concern for me, but I do not think that it would stop me from staying at this Westin again. One final note of caution: Stay away from the Hyatt Regency next door!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: colette2
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had all the amenities, including a fluffy white bathrobe. I even had a treadmill in my room (though I'm told it would normally be an extra cost of $30 had I not gotten the luck of the draw on my business reservation)! Convenient location, and staff always went out of their way to ensure my comfort. One thing I didn't like was the $9.95/day internet charge--why is it that I can get complementary wireless at an Econolodge but not at an upscale hotel (Marriott, this means you too!)? Also, the hotel had no airport shuttle service, so if you're coming by taxi it's between $30 and $40. If you miss the $7/each way Indy Go Green bus (like I did), it's either taxi or a limo service (which you should reserve in advance--$17). Overall, though, I enjoyed the experience and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sold on Starwood”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: Westin Indy is my home away from home. Great service, friendly staff and the best beds in the industry. A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. I have spent over 200 nights in the Westin Indy in the last 10 yrs and it is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MCCLAJW
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Westin in Indianapolis. Once we found the hotel (rush hour traffic, one way streets, kept missing the entrance), the hotel was very nice. We had a package which included parking, club level (evening snacks, breakfast) and internet access all of which was a great deal! Our room was clean and nicely appointed and the bed was comfortable. The staff in the club lounge were very nice and accomodating. The Pedways to the mall, convention center and other areas downtown were a great feature!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: egellman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and the rooms and Beds were comfortable. Nice gym. Starbucks on property. Hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service and unsympathetic Executive Office”
Reviews.Author: roswellga1
Reviews.Content: Except for the Engineering Staff (Barbara and Mark) who was truly sympathetic with their apologies (and offered free internet and free pay per view for the inconvenience,and tried to fix the problems), forget getting any sympathy from the front desk and of all places the executive administrative assistand (Gail H). For a $179/night, what you get is a toilet that does not flush, telephones that don't work, poor room service, and poor communications at the front desk and empty, unsympathetic "apologies" form front desk and Executive Office. In addition you have to pay $10/day for internet at this rate. I complained 3x about toilet not flushing. 1st engineer temporarily fixed the problem but said if it occurred again, inform the front desk that the mechanism has to be changed. When it happened a 2nd time I told front desk what engineer said.about replacing part. When it happened a 3rd time, the front desk said they had no record of any replacement request. I asked to be transferred and they were able to find one and gave me a room that did not have a King bed (which is my original reservation) that had both phones inoperable so I had to call front desk through my cell. They did not even provide room service for the day. I complained to the Executive Office to be transferred to the king bed and she had the gall to ask me if I had a Preferred Guest and how many more nights I was staying. When I asked what difference does it make if I did not have a Preferred Customer, she got defensive and grumpy. She said she would find a room. Since I had to run to a meeting, she said she would call my cell to see what she could do. As soon as I got of the elevator from their 3rd floor office to the Lobby (within 2 minutes), I got a call that there were no rooms available. Sure sounds like they really put an effort to accommodate a regular (non-Preferred Status) guest!!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin; nice location”
Reviews.Author: randomj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference being held nearby. Everything in the downtown area is within walking distance and the Westin is centrally located. This is a typical Westin so the beds are very nice and room furnishings pretty good. The bathroom, though, is very small and feels very cramped. The public areas of the hotel were very nice including a large lobby, a Starbucks downstairs, free wifi and a very friendly staff. It also has a club lounge but you either have to pay extra ($40?) or get upgraded as a platinum SPG. I'm gold so I got nothing. Even the SPG floor was full so they relegated me to a lower floor. Sometimes I wonder whether it's worth being a gold SPG - I can get the same benefits without all the stays. Anyway, although I asked for the upgrade to the club level, it was politely denied. The Westin has an aboveground covered walkway that can take you to other parts of the city through a maze of tunnels. It's great when the weather is bad. Overall, it's a decent hotel in a nice location. However, it's getting a little old and they are a little stingy with upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway Weekend Succes”
Reviews.Author: ajcgocats
Reviews.Content: We were going to a concert downtown and wanted to getaway overnight. The Westin proved to be the perfect spot to get this done. Check-In was easy and they were very friendly. There was alot going on - but they didn't let that bother them. Our room was very good - plenty of room - a chair to relax in and quite the view out of our 14th floor window. There was plenty to do within walking distance, or easy to do nothing if that is what was wanted. We will definitely stay at the Westin Indianapolis again anytime we are staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Westin and found most of meeting rooms spacious, well lit, and ready for presenters' internet access/projection of PowerPoint presentations. My king bed was comfortable. When I arrived, the bathroom seemed to be clean (new towels, drinking glasses, etc.), but there was no new shampoo or conditioner. Instead, the half-used bottles from the previous guest were left in the shower! I'm all for reduce-reuse-recycle, but this was unexpected. A friend picking me up at the end of my stay had difficulty finding the hotel (the maining address does not match the street address of the pick up/drop off area in front of the hotel when entered into a GPS).

Reviews.Title: “Decent property but far below the typical Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: DublinCityCruiser
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with my stay here. The physical property was, on the whole, good. I received a reduced conference rate, which made the nightly rate affordable. The hotel room was average, but was nothing special and certainly not worth the regular room rate. Where the property fell short, in my opinion, was with the guest experience. They nickel and dimed me to the point that it became frustrating. The fridge was packed with their items at exorbitant prices. Remove a bag of candy from the fridge shelf to read the ingredients and a sensor in the fridge records this in their system as a purchase. The same for the bottled water on the cradle. I wanted to make a little space in the fridge so that I could store my sports drink and a yogurt and housekeeping suggested that I rent a fridge from them for an additional $20 daily fee. Why must they do this when there is a fridge in the room already? I had a package delivered from Amazon while I was staying in the hotel and I was charged a $20 receiving fee by the hotel. Room service was also ridiculous. I ordered an already overpriced meal from the menu and was hit with an additional 22% service charge. I really felt that I was being taken advantage of for every service that should be delivered as a courtesy and with a smile. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Nemokota
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here a few years ago so I wasn't too worried about finding it but I should have been! In the dark, in a rental car with poor visibility, with street construction and relying on Google directions using their address of 50 S. Capitol - I circled the block a few times and made two calls to the hotel to find it. If you call the hotel they offer a voicemail menu of directions but that was not helpful since the choices depend on what direction you are coming from and I had long lost any sense of north, south, east or west! A call to a live person finally got me there. The problem is you can't access it from Capitol street so you have to use a west Washington St address for your GPS. Happily when I got to the self park I got a space directly in front of the door. I found the self parking easy and pretty well lit but expensive at $26.00 which you pay at a paystation - not through your hotel bill and there is no cashier. Valet is $32.00. The good news is that when I stayed here at the end of September the construction in the lobby was almost totally done and it was very nice. I also got upgraded to a very nice two room suite with a nice view but it still had a very small bathroom. The Executive Lounge was somewhat of a secret even though it should have been accessible to me since I am Platinum. I asked about it at the desk and was told they had one and my key would let me access it. I got to my room, realized I didn't know where the lounge was, called and asked, was told the 15th floor and assured my key would work. Went to 15th floor and of course my keys didn't work so back down to the lobby and was told then that there was breakfast served there. I didn't make it up to breakfast but was able to grab a Diet Coke, orange and bottle of water there about 9 pm. Think I missed whatever else may have been offered in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: Dear Westin Hotel - Indianapolis, When I stayed there this past August my ipad was stolen from my locked room. I reported it missing as soon as I noticed, which couldn't have been more than a few hours, tops. I felt really violated by the fact that someone had managed to get into my room, and that something so personal was taken. Today I got the letter from your insurance claim adjustor ( who is no longer with the company, I called and that is what they told me), that they weren't liable for the theft or replacing the item that was STOLEN from my LOCKED hotel room. I hope keeping the few hundred dollars was worth the loss of a LOYAL customer, because my husband and I will never, ever stay at your chain again. Thanks for nothing, D. Salvatore

Reviews.Title: “Not the expected Westin expereince”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior124
Reviews.Content: I've been Starwood Platinum for 6+ years and am an enthusiastic Westin fan but I recommend my fellow travelers take a pass on this property. The construction is sloppy and deteriorating, frayed carpets, bowed walls, peeling wallpaper and water fixtures falling off the walls. My room was not serviced and the Service Express operator told me I must have left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. That was not the case (I travel frequently and always check), No apology, no offer of fresh towels or a late service call. I requested coffee refills that usually come with a room refresh - never arrived. The Shula's in the lobby is actually pretty good but understaffed and busy. I guess I really only needed that one beer I was able to get. Most Westin's really know how to take care of the business traveler and I almost always have a great stay. Simply not the case here - try elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: Mholten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Indy for two nights. First the good: Location is good, beds are very comfortable and pool/ workout area are fairly nice. Now the Bad: Small rooms with even smaller bathrooms that have mold and need some serious deep cleaning. Expensive parking $32 for valet and then had our car vandalised by one of the valet or bellman. No return phone calls from security for several days. Awakened Sunday morning by a barking dog in the room next to us at 6:30 in the morning. This was told to front desk at check out with no apology but instead simply, "oh, that's not good, you should have called down to us" $10 wi-fi charge, no refigerator in the room (other than the ridiculously priced self service mini-bar). That should about sum it up. Not what one would expect from a Westin Property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Wonderful customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: teacherash88
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us stayed here in July for my friend's bachelorette weekend! Immeadetly upon check-in we were upgraded to a club level suite (despite the fact that we paid very little for our room after booking on Hotwire) after informing the man checking us in that we were there for a bachelorette weekend. The room was large and spacious and anything we needed was quickly attended to by the hotel employees! Everyone we encountered while staying there was incredibly friendly and helpful providing us with suggestions for where to go, places to eat, etc! They were in the process of renovating the hotel so I can only imagine how nice it will be upon completion. I'm not sure how much the regular rate of room was- we paid only $80 on Hotwire which was an absolute STEAL for the service we received!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced luxury”
Reviews.Author: GStroud
Reviews.Content: One would think that a Westin would be nice, maybe a little higher quality than a Holiday Express. This hotel was dirty and staff not friendly. Let me give a couple of examples. There were three people in the lobby registering guest. A airline pilot and assistant entered the lobby. Immediately they were ushered to the front of the line. I am in line and nothing said to me, explaining why they get to register first. When I got to the guy I asked and he said they just do that - can understand that at the airport, not hotels (unless they are trying to get to the airport). My bathroom towels were threadbare. The tub was dirty and the floor tile cracked. Last point, there were two coffees in the room, both decaffeinated - never could get that straightened out.

Reviews.Title: “Come back in 2012. They might be up to Westin standards by then.”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: This property is under heavy renovation and is really not up to the Westin standards. The first sign was seeing the front desk built with some make shift parts left over from a trade show. The rooms were not bad. Because of the pouring rain I was not able to watch the TV (the remote did not work to boot) or get internet very well, so I discovered a walkway on the second floor that goes all the way to Circle Center Mall without stepping outside. That was an awesome find. I tried to take a shower at night only to find out that there was no hot water. I woke up and still no hot water. Upon Check-Out when I complained about the TV, TV Remote, Internet, and Hot Water I was told that the entire city was without hot water. A little hard to swallow, but ok. I know a lot of hotels that would leave a note for every guest to inform them that they would not be able to shower during their stay. I am sure by 2012 they will have this place up and running like a Westin should be.

Reviews.Title: “Not in a hurry back”
Reviews.Author: denverDonegalIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel a bit of a mess doing some renovations, check in desk dont seem to have all the booking info,operating from what looks like an ice cream stall, but great they have a Starbucks but problem only open from 10 am to 4 pm (most likley times you are not there) Breakfast not great very basic (was looking foward to a big Amercian one) got only low fat yougourt and no Muesli only cornflakes

Reviews.Title: “This Weston needs basic maintenance and a good cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaNana
Reviews.Content: We visit Indianapolis quite frequently and The Weston has always been a favorite place to stay. It is sad to see how bad it has become in just a short amount of time. It is in need of some major maintenance and a good cleaning. We recently attended a conference at the hotel and found the hotel in general, and our room in particular, in very poor shape. The wallpaper was coming off the walls in the bathroom, the cover on the bathroom light was broken and hanging down (this was plastic so it would not have been expensive to replace), the plug in the bathroom wasn't working, and there was very visible dirt and dust around the base of all the furniture. It appeared that it hadn't been cleaned well in a long time. The carpet in the elevators was stained and unsightly. This hotel reflect poorly on the Weston name and we will not stay here again. If we attend a conference at the hotel we will stay somewhere else and walk to the conference. Even at conference rates, this hotel is not worth staying at. I'd rather pay a little more and have a clean, well maintained room someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommyof478
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience this past weekend!! The rooms at this hotel were nothing like they look like on the pictures...bathroom was DIRTYand VERY small. About the only good thing was the beds. A kit kat was 5 dollars!!!! And to top it all off, the 50 dollars we gave them for incidentals, conveniently disappeared and they had no record of me paying the 50 dollars!!! Went thru quite a few stressful hours of describing the girl that helped me, etc. They had to check security cameras, only to discover that because of their "remodel", they couldn't zoom in..therefore couldn't prove I paid her!!!!!!!!!!! We ended up getting the money back, but not without a dirty look, like we were lying about it. UGH, NEVER AGAIN!!!!! WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mwbs1234
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at the Westin. To start, the hallway was Very dark and the carpet was torn in a couple of places. The room was in a state of disrepair and it was dark. There were stains on the chair, the curtains were dirty and there were not amenities like a refrigerator or microwave. The bathroom was nasty, mold and mildew in the tub. The bathroom lighting was poor and falling down. The tempature in the room swung from freezing to boiling. There are many nice hotels around Indy, call around and you can get an updated, clean hotel for half the price!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: tarmac_ted
Reviews.Content: Ideal for any city centre event otherwise nothing exceptional. Very expensive in bar/restaurant but I'm sure other major hotels are comparable. Was very surprised that in-room WiFi was $10 per day as this was the 7th hotel we stayed in on a 3 week tour and the ONLY hotel to charge - come on, Westin, Internet in the room is now as much a utility as water and air. Valet parking was convenient but, again, required deep pockets - parking in the city anywhere is not cheap. Hotel was undergoing refurb but this didn't spoil our stay. We did experience problems with room keys not working and our bill being messed up but these were sorted out reasonably quickly. Room was clean and in reasonable condition -fridge had to be requested. Overall not bad for a city centre hotel but Westin could differentiate themselves by making small changes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Tracy78978978
Reviews.Content: I travel every week for work, frequently to Indianapolis. The staff there always remembers me, and makes my stay enjoyable. This morning, though, I was completely surprised. As usual, I went to the Club Room for breakfast. Steve is the attendant, and he is always gracious and thoughtful to the people who rush through. Today, I had 10 minutes to eat. I was disappointed because they were out of yogurt, but it wasn't a big deal. On my way by, Steve pulled me aside and said, "I saved a yogurt for you, would you like it?" This particular act of kindness was amazing to me because of everything that went into it. First, he had to review the list of people the night before to see who might be coming to the Club Room that next morning. Second, he had to remember the names of the guests. Third, he had to remember each person's preference. You see, Steve and I had never actually talked about yogurt. So, he had observed on his own that I ate yogurt every time I came to the Club Room. Fourth, he must have been watching the supply run low and then saved one for me. It's a small thing, but it was incredibly impressive. Thanks, Steve, you're the best!

Reviews.Title: “A bit faded compared to the newer downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: tbowes
Reviews.Content: The Westin is still a decent hotel in an excellent downtown located connected to the convention center. However, the public areas and rooms are showing signs of needing renovated. Schula's is a nice place to have a night cap before bed. My biggest complaint is that the hotel removed their vending machines. When I called the front desk to confirm that, they informed me I could walk to the Marriott, that they had vending machines. Being late at night, I did not want to do that, so I took a coke from the mini bar not paying attention to the price, but knowing it would be a bit higher. To my surprise the next morning, I woke up with a bill under the door, and that coke was over 5 bucks with tax! And it was just a can!!! Dont use the mini bar!!

Reviews.Title: “very hard to find..dont count on your gps”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: Took me 20 minutes to actually get to the hotel. The physical address leads you to know where. I had to call the front desk to get help. The hotel is under renovation but clean. I stayed over a week and my key locked me out after 5 days? they said it was automatic. That seems a bit silly and wasted my time waiting in line. Room service is decent and the pool is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Major Renovation, There are Better Options Nearby”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: Many recent reviews have pointed out that this Westin is undergoing a renovation. That renovation, however, is limited to the lobby/check-in area. Many more renovations are needed! The corridors are dreadfully dreary. New carpeting, new wall coverings, lighting all are needed. The wireless internet is an added fee, and functional. The fitness center is adequate, but I would expect better from a hotel in the Westin tier of properties. One small positive is that there is a real Starbucks in the lobby. That and the potential for low rates are the only things I see recommending this property. I stayed at it because it was the site for my meeting, and therefore I got an extremely low rate. Otherwise I would opt for either the Hyatt or JW Marriott nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will sell your paid room if you are a late arrival”
Reviews.Author: MaxbMax
Reviews.Content: Max. Very poor regard for reservations paid in advance if you arrive late for check-in. They will sell your room to someone else and tell you they are sold out due to overbooking and try to put you somewhere else. Like Sheraton North, 40 minutes north of downtown. The entire purpose of booking there is to be downtown. Several months ago I made a reservation for my son and his family to stay August 3, 4 and 5 for the annual GameCon event. Due to his wife's father have to have emergency surgery they could not leave until Late Thursday the 4th. Both Westin res line and the hotel direct told me since I had already paid for the room with my hotel points the room would be there for him regardless when he checked in. Notes were place on the reservation to make sure. About 9 PM Thursday I received a call to my cell from John at the hotel asking if someone would be checking in. I called back within an hour and said yes, my son, his wife and two small boys were on there way from Chicago. He said they were oversold and had no rooms. I said they had no right to sell our room. He said they did. I guess our attorney will find out. So much for customer loyalty. I understand another 20 people were having the same thing happen. I think Jerry Jones pulled the same thing for the Superbowl to fans that traveled from all over. Now my son will have to drive from Sheraton North to an early event he has scheduled and leave his family at Sheraton North. When they go it will have to be by cab or Sheraton van. This should be covered by the Westin since it is their fault. I actually thought Westin would be above this kind of thing but John says they overbook all the time. So make sure you always arrive early to avoid your room being sold as well. Anyone experiencing the same treatment at this hotel during this week please contact me for a group complaint to the owners of the hotel, Westin Corporate and maybe something else. mlb0803@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice hotel but currently under construction for remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Spunkykiki
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many time before, but I was surprised to check in to find the property under construction. I am slightly annoyed that the lobby is a mess and the Starbucks has not been operational for the past 2 days. Conditionally recommended - this place should be better post renovation. Until then, there are many other options

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, under construction, promising”
Reviews.Author: HJT4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my way home from a family trip, time away for my wife and I. It had a wonderful location in downtown Indy. The hotel itself was quite old, undergoing refurbishing, probably why we got the nice deal that we did, including valet parking. Everyone was pleasant, had a club level room and access to the club w/ the rate. Was surprised at how little was offered in the club in the evenings . . . diet coke, coke, sprite and coffee/tea and some fruit. It was quite sparse compared to other clubs that I have been in. I was surprised, but another review had mentioned it, so I was not completely shocked. However considering that this was a Westin, I was still surprised. If I had paid a premium rate for the club access, I would have been extremely disappointed. Breakfast was nice, I was late getting there (after posted hours), but they still had enough that I was satisfied and it was well prepared. The gentleman that staffed the breakfast was very helpful. The room was nice, plenty of room for two and the bed was comfortable, but the refrigerator situation was weird, never used it but never really figured out what it was all about. The bathroom was very small, adequate for the two of us, but smaller than in any of the last 20 hotels that I have stayed at, again I was warned in a prior review, so not surprised. Finally, another funny point, there was only one bathrobe available (even though the reservation was for two adults), luckily my wife desired one and I did not, could have been problematic if we both wanted it. Overall, nice, clean and we had a good deal, would stay there again under the same circumstances, but would not want to pay more than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: warriorforkids
Reviews.Content: It is easier to not be critical when you aren't the one footing the bill (the company did) but I would be upset if I had paid high prices for this one. They advertise a spa-like shower experience, but we just had a regular shower and it leaked too. Beds are comfortable. Room is just like a standard hotel room. They did do a good job of feeding and entertaining our large group--just wasn't impressed w/ the room. Also, no free internet either, but that seems to be the norm in the room.

Reviews.Title: “bad situation made good”
Reviews.Author: JJS479
Reviews.Content: I was here for the Kappa event and just wanted to voice an opinion. We stayed at this hotel and it started off really nice the hotel accomidations were ok. We had an issue one day with the room and went down to talk to someone about it at the front desk I believe the guys name was Ed, i think he said he was the manager. He was not very nice in fact he was a bit rude to myself and others in my party when we were trying to get everything situated. He didnt want to hear anything we wanted to say and just kinda shooed us away. I was a bit heated so went back to the room and called down, in hopes of getting someone who would be a bit more helpful. I spoke to a girl I think her name was Jess or Jessica. Anyway, she was GREAT, complete opposite of the other guy. I explained the situation to her, and not only did she remedy it but she even gave a follow up phone call to make sure we were all taken care of. Kuddos to her.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AJWCMW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to live it up for a night so we thought the Westin was a good choice. When we walked into the hotel we were very impressed but that didn't last long. The room was very dated and extremely small. The bathroom was so small the door couldn't open all the way and the shower sprayed up and out over the shower curtain. I was hoping for a room like what was pictured on the site and it was far from it. The bed was very comfortable and clean so I will give them that. It was in a great location as well so that was a plus. We just wanted something a little more luxurious for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine.”
Reviews.Author: Juliatheprofessor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference since the new JW Marriott was sold out. First room had a rattle in the AC so I requested a room change which solved the problem. Everything was clean, elevators are fast and the skywalks connect everything. Internet is around $10 per day which is annoying for a $140+ room. GPS will say you have 'arrived at destination' but parking is tricky.

Reviews.Title: “not so great for cost”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: Very expensive...costly, so-so front desk, so-so breakfast, costly parking

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but everything is extra”
Reviews.Author: spaceheartl4
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel at a discount. The room was clean, the view overlooking downtown Indianapolis was beautiful. Just beware the internet is extra ($10/day), as is parking (about $25 for 24 hours), but paid parking is common in the middle of a big city. Also, DON'T TOUCH the snack/mini bar items, they are weight sensitive! Seems to be a common issue though since they came to check and saw we hadn't eaten ours so we weren't charged. The bar downstairs was about what you would expect (~$10 cocktails) but service was a bit understaffed. Fitness center had plenty of cardio machines, all were very nice with towels and headphones with individual tvs on the screen. Didn't use the pool or hottub but they seemed clean. Very centrally located hotel, riverfront only about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Overpriced - Smallest Bathroom Ever”
Reviews.Author: BadDiver
Reviews.Content: My entire family was booked here for a family wedding. While the central location was great, the rooms ... not so much. This was absolutely the SMALLEST bathroom I have ever seen in an "upscale" hotel. Barely room for one person to stand; inadequate counter space; plugs that wouldn't stay plugged in, mold in the shower, etc. They did provide a bathrobe - ONE bathrobe for two people. I asked them if we were supposed to flip a coin over who got to wear it ... they finally said they could send another up to the room. The only restaurant onsite is Shula's Steakhouse (super expensive) and a Starbucks. The onsite parking is ridiculously expensive!!! On the plus side, the exercise room is phenomenal and the lobby is very nice. However, I was there for three nights ... after the first I should have checked out and gone to the Holiday Inn Express across the street; I'm betting the bathrooms there were more spacious and they throw in breakfast as well!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lex682
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel - both times for business. It is close to everything. The staff is always professional and easy to work with and the rooms are clean and well appointed. I would highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, a little long in the tooth like most CBD Westins”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: Like the Westin Crown Center in KC, this one needs a serious job on exterior windows. That said, this property is nice and in reasonably good condition. I was upgraded to an SPG corner suite which is impressive and has a wonderful view of the capitol. So here it is straightforward: THE GOOD: - central location with good access to downtown area - sharp lobby, great SPG lounge - easy access in and out, valet is fast - nice corner suite with great views for upgraded SPG - room appeared and felt quite clean THE BAD: - the bathroom is very tight, and the toilet bowl is small to sit on - pool had a mysterious odor and was very basic - hot tub in pool area needs a scrub down - no free booze in the SPG lounge - no plastic laundry bags - dirty panoramic windows - bathroom was a little dingy and smelled musty (lack of consistent vigorous cleaning of commode) All in all I would stay again as I did not hear great things about the JW and it is inconveniently located to the center of action, however the Conrad would still be my first choice, rate permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Shadow1999
Reviews.Content: Looks very nice from the outside, but rooms smell funny, mold in the shower. Internet expensive. Front desk staff did not seem knowledge and in a hurry to get rid of you. Someone standing in line with me was told he could not get a receipt for his stay. Would not recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Service was phenomenol”
Reviews.Author: CRMays
Reviews.Content: I fell outside of the hotel at the end of the drive. I couldn't get up immediately and a bellman named Gerald ran to help. Not only did he pick me up, but he walked me in holding my arms. He was a very humble and kind man. Once inside everyone was very accomadating. I have stayed in this hotel many times. The service has always been good, but this was above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ttklein40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the Women's Big Ten Tournament. Every staff member went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and that our stay was a good one. The room was spacious and clean. The location downtown is within walking distance to many restaurants and shops and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kle1974
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! We were in Indy for a race at Lucas Oil and were within a few minutes walk to the stadium. Great location! The room was great! We were in room 1008 which had an awesome view of the Capital Building. I had read reviews that it was has a small bathroom but I didn't think that at all. I was very satisfied with the size of the bathroom and the room. We didn't use the parking at the hotel because there is a garage on the other side of the Marriott that was half the price. I was very happy with this hotel and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: MLandLM
Reviews.Content: Overall a good stay. You have to pay for parking on top of the room. The desk staff wasn't really on top of things and the hotel is showing it's age. Overall a nice stay and very close the everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Cafe feeling.”
Reviews.Author: youngworldtravelers
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at a Westin in Indianapolis and I was a bit disappointed. Lets start off on a positive note though, the rooms were nice! Comfortable bed and clean! The food at Shula's was also delicious! I would definitely recommend Shulas! The big draw back was the internet. I was traveling for business and needed to send a few emails. The internet in the rooms was not free which is totally standard and understandable. Since I only need to do a few things I decided just to walk down to the business center only to find out that it was just like an internet cafe! .49 per minute 3 min minimum! You are kidding right? Not only am I paying close to $200 per night but there is not internet and no breakfast. Sorry Westin but that was a bust!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't plan on sleeping through the day”
Reviews.Author: BackYardDad
Reviews.Content: Feb 2011 - Indianapolis, massive ice storm. I was stuck downtown and not able to get home and my company put me up in the hotel for one night so that I could get some rest. I work nights and had a 2 day reservation so that I could sleep during the day. Arriving at the hotel is what is expected, nice lobby, nice staff. Check in was okay and quick. Like others who reviews this hotel, I did have problems with the room and stay. First, the cordless phone did not work. But there was a corded phone there and it worked. Everything cost, I was scared even to sit on the bed, wasn't sure if there was a surcharge. Water $4.00, candy bar $5.00...wow. Well the bed was comfy, lots of pillows, but I could hear everything that was happening in the room next to me, the TV, the water running, the toilet flushing. I figured since I got there in the morning (to sleep all day) that it would end soon....I was wrong. I heard all of housekeepings duties, heard door's opening and closing, heard people talking in the halls, heard loud bangs. The rooms do not have a nice loud A/C or heater to drown out the noise. Needless to say, I did not sleep well during the day. But I figure most people sleep at night so the noise probably not so bad then. Like other people, I found the bathroom extremely small, lots of mold and rust in the bathroom, but it didn't keep me from using the facilities. Just if you are a large person, don't expect to get in the bathroom and close the door. If you plan on staying here, high speed internet is $10.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Indy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DallasGatr
Reviews.Content: I was stunned to see this facility rated so low. Beautiful hotel, standard great Westin rooms, good fitness room, great location. I've stayed here many times over the years and have always enjoyed my stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: The first impression I got was okay, the lobby is nice, but it smelled of natural gas. We checked in and got our room. We went to the room and the halls were narrow, dingy, and dimly lit. The room at first glance was fine. I forgot something in my car so I went to the valet desk and asked for my car so I could retrieve my forgotten item. The valet gave me my keys and directions to the valet lot and my parking spot number. Not sure why I paid extra for valet. We were at an event at the convention center, so the walkway to the convention center was wonderful. The bathroom was filthy. There was mold in the shower and on the door hinges. The phone didn't work, you couldn't answer it. The desk kept calling and we had to call them from our cell phone to tell them the phone was broken. They never offered to send someone to fix it. When we shared our concerns at checkout, the man at the desk was indifferent. We had pictures of the bathroom and he didn't look at them. He told us they would take the room off the market to get it cleaned. I asked to speak to a manager and none was available. It took me 2 days of calling the Westin and their corporate office to get a response.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: panhandleguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin for a night away and to attend the Colts game. Parking was expensive but it was about the same as any other hotel in town so no big complaint there. The room was very nice with a great view of the City, I just thought the room and the bathroom was a little small. The staff was nice at check in and we had no problems with our room so I didnt have any other interaction with them, we did not eat at the restaraunt (although I would have liked to, time just didnt allow with a playoff game) I wasnt really a fan of the "snack bar" in the room that had overpriced snacks sitting on sensors that alerted the desk and billed you if one was removed, but I guess its a way to make money so I understand. The hotel is very nice and convienant to downtown with attaching skywalks to several places. We have stayed at alot of hotel downtown and this one is at the top of the list, I liked it alot better than the Hyatt, but not quite as well as embassey suites (which is closer to the circle but farther away from lucas oil) All in all I'd say you cant go wrong staying here.
