Reviews.Title: “Great place and great food!”
Reviews.Author: HungryBackpacker
Reviews.Content: While this is as good as any other westin, what I loved was the restaurant on site - Shula's. It makes your day when you can end it with the salmon and sides and Shula's and then snuggle back to your room upstairs with a bottle of wine! Definitely recommended; especially if you are on a business trip. I could find no other hotel in the downtown area that was more comfortable and convenient. Make sure you reserve though; I find it tough getting a room here at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Colmklein
Reviews.Content: I am writting this review to commend John the front desk associate at the hotel. Due to a winter storm me, my wife and teenager daughter were forced to extend our stay one more night after a Cheerleading event (12 Dec). John was a savior finding us a room in record time and helping us in every way possible. What a wonderful experience under stressful conditions . Please commend this fine individual for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTasia2U
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice hotel. The beds are very comfortable. I did have problems with the internet and my drain and I know things like this do happen. However, Bob Miller with the Engineering was very helpful. He was very polite and fixed my internet even though that isn't what he came up to fix. The rest of the staff was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “close to downtown mall and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette49
Reviews.Content: Hotel could use some upgrades. Room service hours have been decreased over the recent past, Shula's service/food has gone down (hotel restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff, Otherwise Average Accomodations for an Above-Average Price”
Reviews.Author: easy1toplease
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely smiley and nice, but the hotel itself is just average - and IMHO overpriced for being so average. The phone in my room didn't work, the showerhead in the bathroom was extremely scaly, the towels were rough and scratchy . . . and a yogurt in the morning costs $6. The bottle of water they placed in the room cost $4. And it costs $10 for wireless! There's a bar-b-q joint my town that offers free wireless, but you pay $150 for a hotel room and they can't throw that in too??? There is also a business center whose computers you can use, but it costs $0.59 cents/minute - no thanks! Also, when I tried to call the front desk (with my cell, because the phone in the room didn't work) the most appropriate choice on their menu of options was for Reservations. When I got in touch with Reservations, I discovered that a) the employees taking reservations are in CANADA and b) they don't give out correct information anyway. I was asking if they have toothbrushes if you forgot yours and was told NO. Later I found a card in the room that listed free amenities - and guess what? - they DO provide toothbrushes. I would have left all the above on a comment card, except NONE was provided in the room. In sum - Motel 8 accomodations, Four Seasons prices!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: erjer08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary the hotel was great. I loved that it has a Starbucks right in the lobby.It is also in an ecxellent location so close to all the great spots, the mall, musuems,bars, cafes,restaruants. The only think we didnt like at all adn would not recomemmend was the Restaraunt "Shulas" located in the hotel. We had heard this place was a great place to eat. However our steaks were not cooked the way we had asked, so we sent them back and they still werent right, so we ended up leaving most of the steak on the plate. My was so chewy I felt like I had peice of tough bubble gum in my mouth, my jaw hurt from chewing that I couldnt even finish. It was way over priced for what we got and they didnt even offer a discount off the food!!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin, Indianapolis: Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: leichlit
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed at the Westin for business, it was "all pleasure." From the quick and courteous check-in, to the extremely comfortable room, to the equally quick and courteous check-out, I was more than pleased. The conference facilities were excellent (except for a few heating/cooling issues that were quickly remedied) and the staff was attentive and efficient. And I appreciated the "green" options. I would highly recommend the Westin for visitors to Indianapolis. It is centrally located to many other city venues within walking distance, and a short walk over the enclosed skywalk allows vistors to access the mall without braving the weather. I wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: The Westin Indianapolis is a nice (not great) hotel located in an ideal location attached to the convention center. The rooms ae comfortable and the heavenly beds are indeed heavenly. The hotel is large, but smallish compared to those located in big cities. Service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located”
Reviews.Author: Lo_in_WI
Reviews.Content: After the large group of high school students left, the hotel became a fine place to stay. On the first day of a three-day stay, my room wasn't cleaned until after 6 p.m., but given the capacity crowd, I guess that was okay. The hotel is in a great location with sky-walks to the mall, convention center, and restaurants. Given that we had nasty weather, the location was perfect. The fitness center was clean and well-appointed. Good selection of machines. I wish they had a shutte to the airport, though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, but has its problems”
Reviews.Author: OKCChildpsych
Reviews.Content: I'm going to say I'll recommend this Westin, but with a strong reservation. If you need spotless, continuous Internet, bring your own connectivity (front desk staff say the system is about to be replaced, but it hasn't happened as of this posting). The hotel is beautiful and ideally situated for downtown activities and conferences- we never had to take a taxi and during foul weather citygoers can stay inside to get to almost every attraction and restaurant. There is one staff- Jason, to be exact- who goes out of his way to provide excellent service to each customer he sees. I didnt get to know the others as well, but I only experienced friendly staff throughout the stay. It also houses its own medium-sized workout facility and indoor pool/jacuzzi. It is missing a spa, which would have been great as I had two back-to-back trips and could have used some TLC. But th at's not a complaint- most hotels here don't have in-house spas. I only have two issues of concern: the close presence of the restaurant- which is starting to smell less 'fresh,' has seeped into the lobby carpets and even the elevator landings. I could smell it all the way up to my room near the top floor. Secondly- and this is my chief concern- the ibahn Internet system at the hotel has significant issues. The hotel ended up comp'ing my internet (for which I'm eternally grateful) because neither wireless nor cabled internet was working in my room. The hotel also advertises free lobby wifi service, but, along with 5 or 6 other lobby denizens, I was unable to keep the connection going for more than a few minutes, and the staff was baffled by repeated complaints, unable to give anyone a working answer or look into the problem while we were there. Will I stay here again? Probably- they host a conference I attend on a yearly basis and the rooms are terrific, as well as the staff I met. I strongly suggest they either get ibahn to permanently fix the connectivity and signal issues, or find a new provider. And maybe replace the food-smelling carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay..”
Reviews.Author: hoaty
Reviews.Content: First off I got a good deal with Priceline, so I can't say anything about the cost. And I was very satisfied with my stay as far as my room went. Second, I did not need to park so can't comment on that. I was there for four nights. I needed 2 days of Internet, so I paid the $20.00 for that. Personally I think all, and any high end hotels should offer free internet. Or at least not $10.00 a day. .. I did not eat at the Westin. The first morning I looked at the room service menu and saw 2 eggs any style for $12.00. At $6.00 an egg we decided to go out. Right next door there is a Patachou and we had a very nice breakfast there. In fact we went there every day to eat breakfast. Upon check-in the clerk nicely suggested that the snacks in the room are on a sensor. "So even if you pick up a snack and place it back down, you will be charged" he warned us. Needless to say I tried not to bump into that obstacle for fear I might shake up the candies! All that said the stay was nice. The room was clean and bathroom spacious. Breakfast, Lunch, & Dinner were done out in Indianapolis. I was there during the Colts - Giants game, and the Giants were staying in the hotel. As well as Archie & Olivia Manning. So it certainly has a good rep. I did use the gym and the pool. Both well maintained...Clean, quite, comfortable, Overall a very nice stay. But wasn't involved in some of the things that a lot of complaints seem centered on. .. oh one quick note, the room has a flat screen tv, very nice, and the remote stopped working. I called down and they said they would send a service man right up with a new one, and 4 minutes later with a knock on the door came a new working remote... can't leave a man without his remote !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay but Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: caliey
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean; comfortable bed; nice TV; The staff was great. Cons: Thin walls (could hear everything in the hallway and in next room, slamming doors); extremely dirty windows (note photos). Maid service didn't come until 4:00 one day, so she had to clean the bathroom and make the bed while I was there. The room had been empty for 4 1/2 hours (11:00 to 3:30). A bit of an inconvenience when I wanted to lie down and relax after walking the entire city. Was there with my husband who had business meetings. Food was just okay for the luncheons that the hotel supplied. Starbucks right off the lobby. The bathrooms were small but fine for the two nights we were there. The two headed shower was very weird. No one could figure the "why" of it. Shula's was excellent. Loved walking the city. Great looking museums, architecture, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Allie218
Reviews.Content: The Westin did not live up to our expectations for a 4 star hotel. The positives: great location, great view from our room, beautiful lobby, comfortable bed, and a Starbucks in the lobby. Those are probably the only good things I can say about this hotel. The walls were paper thin and we were awakened time after time at night by noise from the hallways. While in the bathroom, I could hear someone in the room next door relieving himself. Gross! The carpet in the room and hallway was stained. There was a pile of extension cords and wires behind the mini-fridge that not only looked very tacky but also like a fire hazard. Forget ammenities, there is an extra cost to everything at the Westin. The self parking cost was outrageous. I expect to pay a parking fee downtown but with this garage, ANYTIME you parked for more than 2 hours and left again you were charged $26. As a paying hotel guest, I expect a daily charge that doesn't change no matter how often I come and go, not to be paying every single time I leave. If you plan on driving anywhere during your stay, do not stay here! They tried to talk us into valet but that was also at a high price. I think it is a joke to pay for high-speed internet in this day and age and they use a per computer charge, not per room charge. My husband and I both needed to use our laptops when there and it was going to cost us $40 for two days of internet use. We called the front desk to ask if this was indeed the case and a nice man agreed that it was crazy to have to pay per computer and waived us the cost of one of them. We won't be staying here again as there are much nicer hotels nearby that are a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “some hotel staff steals valuables from guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: 12samos12
Reviews.Content: at check-in a staffer evidently noticed my watch, which, along with my wallet and iPodTouch, were all stolen later from my room. Yes, of course I had locked the door! Obviously an inside job. The staffer evidently made several months' worth of income from that little heist.

Reviews.Title: “Diassapointed”
Reviews.Author: Denverfoodlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not up to my expectations of a Westin hotel.I was disappointed upon checking into my room. The bathroom floor was not clean and was missing the shampoo and conditioner. The bathroom was very small. The bedroom was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The other disappointment was the breakfast. We were seated at a table with a dirty placemat and only one serving. We opted to move down two tables where the table was complete with silverwear and napkins. The plus with the hotel is that is is close to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: timzmail
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Indy on a whim. The first time in 28yrs we had gone away for a couples get away and not a family vacation. We booked thru hotwire so we can't complain about the price we paid for the room. The room did need updating. We noticed something smeared on our comforter and it was quite noticeable. After the room was "cleaned" we discovered they had only flipped the comforter so that the stain was at the bottom of the bed. Guess they were hoping we wouldn't notice? Also, we had only one bar of soap- no shampoo, lotion, etc. And our alarm clock went off both mornings- at 5:30 am and the next morning at 5:40!! Tend to think housekeeping moved the button while cleaning. Overall just an ok hotel but the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was okay, BUT DO NOT VALET YOUR VEHICLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bhaywardjr
Reviews.Content: Overall, my colleagues and I enjoyed our stay minus the mold in the refrigerator and the valet that decided to pilfer a book of postage stamps from the console in my vehicle. Considering the additional charge for valet, you would think that you wouldn't have to hide something as simple as a book of stamps. Other than that, the treadmill and workout equipment in the rooms came in handy and Shula's Steakhouse was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “ALL YOU CAN ASK FOR AND MORE”
Reviews.Author: buya40
Reviews.Content: Please take full advantage of all the hotel offers Heavenly beds, great food, centrally located, professional staff, quiet during sleeping hours, well maintained, nice linens Need i say more? self or valet parking, housekeeping pronto, refrigerators upon requests, updated rooms, city views, skywalk connections to shopping, convention center and short walk to Lucas stadium. Overall a luxury hotel with affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “still not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 3duckdave
Reviews.Content: After staying at this hotel before and reading many reviews, I don't understand why people have so many problems when they stay here. We booked a night here again using Priceline, got a great deal. I had no problems checking in or out. The desk attendant mentioned/ warned us about the vending machine/ mini bar in the room. Which I already knew to avoid. One thing I didn't notice before was that the bottle of water on the TV stand is also weight sensored like the mini bar. On this visit we had room 1136, on the eleventh floor. The room wasn't very big, but still felt spacious, even with a King bed. It had chair as well as a business center/desk area with office chair, and about a 32 in. flat screen TV. The bathroom was very small, and also very dark. Great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The bath tub did lack any kind of traction tape. I was apparent that there had been some at one time, but none was present during our stay. Be warned the tub is slippery when wet. I should mention that you will need your room card to enter the room with the ice machine and soda machine, kind of a pain. Other than that i still think the Westin is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: heartshoes
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. I've stayed at other Westin's and they have been wonderful. I still can't believe the Westin chain would put their name on this hotel. It felt like kids were running the hotel and they all seemed completely overwhelmed. 1. The bed was lumpy and hard 2. There was no noise control 3. Our room key had to be reprogrammed after every entry 4. The staff didn't know where anything was 5. We wanted a cab and they told us to go get one. They called one after WE suggested they get one for us. 6. The air conditioning was completely out of wack. The heat would go on if the thermostat hit 68 degrees 7. Carpet was dirty 8. Someone spilled some kind of beverage in the elevator and it was there waiting for someone to slip on for over an hour I'm hoping they were remodeling because the overall feel was very generic and had no style. We will never stay there again and I'm very hesitant to ever stay at another Westin.

Reviews.Title: “What a fiasco- avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DocBocaraton
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel, with no awareness that this was across the street from the Black Expo. We literally could not return to the hotel last night, as all streets were blocked off, with no forewarning from the hotel! We literally had to circle the area for 2 hours before a policewoman finally succumbed to our begging. In the restaurant, the dishes and glasses were dirty. The "concierge" desk was unavailable dueling our entire stay. I was shocked by the lack of communication on the part of the hotel staff with the hecticness of the place. I would strongly recommend avoiding this hotel, as there are so many other choices. Shame on the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: LolaFamilyOfThree
Reviews.Content: This was the first time at a Westin and my husband and I loved it! It was nice, clean and comfortable. It was just walking distance from the places we wanted to go. My favorite part, the bed!!! I want one, slept like a baby! And a great view from the 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Really, Westin - You've Done So Much Better In The Past”
Reviews.Author: AimeeLeigh
Reviews.Content: The valet drivers and people at the front desk were very nice and polite...but the hotel itself? Ick. Leaking faucets in the bathroom, no cold water coming out of the taps, filthy shower, a broken AC (the room was hot and humid and we couldn't do anything about it), questionable towels, and paper thin walls...it was really disappointing, actually. Especially since the other Westin hotels I've stayed in have been GLORIOUS. The location is ideal - you're close to downtown but you don't get all the noisy foot traffic - and their restaurant downstairs isn't that bad, either. All in all, very disappointing, but I'm still going to stick with Westin hotels when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: The lobby area was nice as was the exterior. It was in a excellent location but that's the best of it. The room was worn and had seen better days. I was shocked how bad the rooms were for a Westin. I don't think I would stay here again, the Hyatt down the block was a much better stay...

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: confused_1987
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was probably the most appealing thing about the hotel. The elevatiors where fast but the doors opened before it stoped so please don't stand to close. The the tables in the hallways looked like the came from a used store and the layed marble on top of them, they where scrachted all over. The carpet looked like it was the carpet they installed when the hotel opened. When walking into the room it looked like any other room but we soon found different. The bathroom was so small you had to squeeze between the sink and toilet just to shut the door. The sink itself was falling out of the counter the only thing holding it up was the drain pipe. There was what appeared to be gum stuck on the floor. The showerhead was nice but not what it was made out to be by other reviews. The bed was probably the nicest thing about the room but the pillows where stained. The little fridge was full of the hotels stuff and was very over priced $7.00 for a bottle of water. The chair and foot rest didn't match and had a spring trying it's best to come through the seat of the chair. The parking was way over priced they charged us $30 dollars a day. They left our lights on and in the the car needed to be jumped. Please read this review before considering staying at the Westin in Indianapolis I would not recommend this hotel to a friend or anyone for that unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a fantastic location but needs new housekeeping guidlines”
Reviews.Author: deejayplus2
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. The location is fantastic with the skywalk that lets you get around downtown Indy without getting out in the elements. Unfortunately, this hotel needs help with cleanliness. When we checked into our first room, there was a smear of what we assume was chocolate and crumbs over the white bedding. Yuck! We called downstairs immediately & they gave us the room to a new room and told us to meet them there. We went to the new floor & stood outside the room for awhile waiting for someone to meet us. Finally someone else came to occupy the room so we had to go back downstairs to get another room. After finally receiving a 3rd room, we were all set. The room had a great view & was quite spacious. Unfortunately, the shower was nasty - little curly black hairs & other gross stuff smeared on the wall of the shower, plus the back of the bathroom door. I dropped the back of an earring on the floor in the bathroom and was greeted with all kinds of dust bunnies under the bathroom sink. The bed was clean so we decided to go ahead & stay. The room with the pool was dirty as well. There was trash and spilled food items all over the floor. I understand that a group could have just been there but we came back hours later and the mess was still there. The pool water was cloudy & you could not see the bottom. The hot tub was also dirty and the jets were on so strong there was nothing relaxing about sitting in the hot tub. That is the first hot tub I have ever sat in and had water continually, violently splash me in the face. The location of this hotel was fantastic but their housekeeping department really needs to kick it up about 10 notches. Ewww!

Reviews.Title: “Whilwind Weekend was worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: ravey_baby24
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at a Westin and it was a tad expensive on our budget but the 2 night stay was well worth it! The staff was friendly especially the bartender we met at Don Sulah's Steakhouse. The bed was so comfortable I looked into purchasing the type of mattress they had in the room! We would happily spend another anniversary weekend at this Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Wireless issues”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSPGPlatinum
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to your hotel for the past few years - on average about 7/8 times per year. I am a platinum member of SPG - and stay at various SPG properties across the country. The wireless service in your hotel is by far the worse I have experienced in any SPG property. And has been for the past 1.5 years. I have complained numerous times (and always ensured it will work better the next time), but every time I come back - it is the same issues. Will it ever get fixed????? Makes me wonder why I keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “the sheets were crunchy”
Reviews.Author: jkwitt
Reviews.Content: OK. my husband and i stayed here just a random saturday night, after dinner and drinks in downtown indy. i'm not sure if we're just spoiled by our amazing bed at home... but the bed was very uncomfortable. and the sheets were crunchy. and, by accident, the bottom sheet came untucked and there was blood stain on the mattress! uck! paint was peeling off the vanity in the bathroom. room was small. view was nothing spectacular. honestly, we recently stayed at the sheraton in downtown indy and it was a much comfy-ier experience. rooms are more updated at the sheraton (and much better view of downtown indy). with all of that being said, the service at the westin was attentive and friendly. but save the money. stay at a different hotel in downtown indy.

Reviews.Title: “You are not valued at this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: affliction711
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotwire.com, got a great value, but upon arrival, it seems they treat us differently because we didnt book directly thru them. No apologies when our King room wasnt available...was moved the next night to a king size bed....ON THE 13th FLOOR! I wasnt too freaked out about the 13th floor until we barely missed being hit by a car and hearing gunshots....most hotels skip floor 13....we became freaked out and asked to be moved to a different floor to ease our comfort level....we were told to ask for Eric and he would take care of us. Im assuming Eric is a front desk manager, but he was gone by the time we got to the desk. I lady by the name of Mary was cold and unaccomodating from the moment i began talking to her. I explained my situation and she told me she had no rooms availble...3/4 of the hotel was empty!!! Then told me to explain it with management in the morning......it would be irrelevant by then! I told her Eric wwas working with us, but she said he left no notes for her...i asked her to make something happen to satisfy our request, then she got on the phone and claimed she was being discriminated against!!!! The only ones discriminated against was us....we prompty left the hotel and called to check out...all she did was say, you wont get refunded....if you want to be treated badly, stay here. If not, I advise you to look elsewhere. Happy New Year....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: V22_Osprey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin during the 2009 MLB Winter Meetings, as did many others from the baseball community. Real nice place, very friendly check-in staff, very clean, good location. Would definitely recommend staying here. The good: bed and pillows were super comfortable, room was very large, clean, modern and had a super large window view of dreary downtown Indy. Nice big LCD HDTV, bathroom was very clean and had plenty of towels, soap, etc... $5 "green" voucher is a very cool idea for saving room service. Elevators are fast and there's a bunch of them. Shower was nice too. The bed and pillows were incredible though. The not-so-good: my room, which had two beds, lacked a dresser or place to store clothes besides hangers in the closet (the TV cabinet actually just had some liquor glasses and a safe for valuables. Oops; I left my clothes on the bed in my luggage). The wi-fi/internet was not free, although co-workers at nearby hotels had free internet... I was jealous. Wanted to print my airline boarding pass, but you needed to swipe a credit card before even using a computer... ouch, I didn't bother. A cleaning lady actually keyed into my room at 9am on my last day while I was sleeping, not sure why... check-out is at noon. That's probably not a typical incident though -- overall the Westin is a nice place, I slept very well, the restaurants downstairs are cool, as is the lobby and the location to the convention center and other nearby hotels and restaurants/bars in town. Honestly don't know the room price, it was covered for me. Had a very enjoyable stay, would recommend. Related, other co-workers did not enjoy the nearby Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: iloveItalyUsa
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this hotel. The location, lobby and employees were very above average. As soon as we stepped into the room, it was a different story. The rooms are small, dingy and depressing. The bathroom is very small and had mildew in the shower. We had two rooms and the other room was worse than the one my husband and I stayed in. The beds for us were not comfortable but most people like the "heavenly" bed. The bottom sheets are not fitted (we are in the US, not Europe) and both nights my husband and I woke up on the bare mattress. There was a hefty fee for internet service, found out later other hotels in the area had little or no fee. The carpets in our rooms were stained, and worn out, we wore shoes when we were in the room at all times. I think it is time for major renovations in the guest rooms, I have stayed at the Westin in downtown Charlotte and it was everythning this one wasn't. Also, the second night we were there, there was a football championship, rude and loud kids were everywhere, running up and down the halls screaming all hours of the night. We called the front desk and were told it would quite down at midnight, no such luck, I should blame the parents for this, not so much the hotel. Anyway...I would not stay here again unless I was told the rooms had been renovated, overall as you can tell, we were not the least bit impressed.

Reviews.Title: “NIce, basic Westin - Can't go wrong, but not remarkable”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBriggs
Reviews.Content: Really a very nice business hotel. Rooms were clean, the bed was fantastic (as usual with the Heavenly Beds), and the staff was very friendly though check-in was a bit slow. The front desk folks pointed us to some local restaurants, and they were always very genuine. Starbucks is in the hotel. As a big business hotel, it is not particularly unique - just sort of your basic Westin.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here; I am in town for a conference and had to stay here for five days. It was not within my budget because I could not get a roommate for the conference; but I needed to be close to the Convention Centre. Every review I read on line was awful. So I am here to refute that...I know my stay is not over yet, but I want to tell you about Eric who works the front desk. I came in on Tuesday night and I had a serious glitch with my pay and my credit card!!! Not fun...I had just purchased an airline ticket the day before and I was in another hotel earlier that morning in Canada which froze part of my funds. My pay is transferred automatically to my card, but that had not happened yet!!! So, I could only cover one night; at a time when the hotel was overbooked. First of all Eric, was wonderful because a. he did not cancel my reservation, but let me pay for two nights and then put notes on my account. He was patient, and I feel went over and above his call to duty in helping me. I can honestly even say that as a Black Woman I was not treated with any prejudice or preconceived notions. He told me he trusted me...and I thank God he was so pleasant, patient and professional. My pay did come in early in the a.m. the next morning as promised, and I paid my balance about 4:00 am, as I said I would. So, yes its expensive, yes sometimes the people at the desk when you call are comical and I have had a few experiences with that. But, at the end of the day, its how you are treated as a client that matters. Eric, to me did an excellent job, and I am very thankful for that. Now I have three more nights left here, and so far I have had breakfast at Shula's Steak House and again I found the staff friendly and breakfast to me was pretty average for a hotel. $12.00 or eggs, potatoes, toast. So to all of you who complained an almost made me stay in another hotel less convenient...I can say that so far I don't have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: HolaGatitos
Reviews.Content: As others have said this is the typical business hotel where rooms are overpriced, internet is never included ($10 a day??--I was able to connect to the Indiana free wireless service coming from the capitol?), and other amenities are either missing or forgettable. I have never understood why Westin makes this big deal about a "Heavenly Bed" I mean what is the point of having a so-called heavenly bed if you are going to use sandpaper for sheets. And the special dual shower head???....I would just settle for water pressure instead. Public areas are kind of small and there is only one restaurant/bar (Shula's) where they serve overpriced steaks, watered down drinks, and indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our young children while taking in some of the family friendly attractions available in Indy. Found this to be a very average Westin. Lobby area is fine, rooms are average with small bathroom. Location is convenient-walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Beds are extremely comfortable. Check-in was very slow. We were #6 in line on a Sat at 4pm with only 1 person working the desk. Pool was uncomfortably cold(wouldn't have stayed here if we'd known that). We ate at the restaurant for breakfast(Shula's). The service was poor, food wasn't particularly good and was overpriced. We had booked the deal where breakfast is included-note that they give a set amount of credit on your bill. There is no breakfast buffet and with the prices they charge this was no great deal. Would definitely not book this type of package and would have breakfast elsewhere(there was a Starbuck's in the lobby and there is a shopping mall with restaurants and a Cinnabon's about 2 blocks away). We are frequent visitors to Indy and are still looking for a top notch hotel experience. Have had mediocre experience at the Hyatt(although a few years ago). Will probably try the well reviewed Conrad Hilton next time. Looks like there is a JW Marriott being built in downtown Indy so something to look forward to!

Reviews.Title: “Showing signs of wear and tear...”
Reviews.Author: gopoets
Reviews.Content: The Westin used to be the top choice in Indy...but not any more. The hotel is really starting to show signs of heavy wear and tear. The location is still good but the rooms are beaten up and the public spaces are just OK. They still have the Westin beds but that's about it. With the new Marriott going up 1/2 a block away and the Conrad about two blocks away, the Westin is now longer THE spot to stay in Indy. I think I'd rather stay at the Marriott almost right next door. Kind of sad to see the decline at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “I could overlook the updates that are needed if the service was good.”
Reviews.Author: jtjaknepper
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple, the cold snub given by the man behind the check in desk when you get there, just drives home any other flaws that you may find with this place. Just keep going and find a place to stay that has friendly staff. It was as though our arrival at the hotel was a real inconvenience to this person. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Fantastic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: robbyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an opportunity to stay at the Indy Westin while I was in town doing some radio business for the All State 400 at the Brickyard and the Indianapolis Convention and Visitors Association between July 24th and 26th. We arrived just after dinner time after spending the Friday at the track, and really wanted to relax and rest up for a fun day Saturday. As other reviewers have mentioned, even though the address is Capitol Avenue, you need to go around the block to pull into the drive. We didn't have a big problem finding the entrance. Yes, self parking in the underground garage is $25 a day with no in & out. Valet parking is $28, and you can come and go as you please. With only 3 dollars difference, do the Valet. The Westin isn't a cheap place by any stretch of the imagination. The in room vending machine is expensive (refrigerated mini bar), internet access in the room expensive and I would assume there are charges to use the phone and computers in the business center. (I didn't look too much into it as I had just stayed at a Starwood Hotel in Minn. a couple of weeks earlier so I wasn't shocked at the extra charges.) The hotel had a Steak House in it (too rich for us), a Starbucks (went there every morning!) and a gift shop. The gift shop very convenient, but obviously, pricey. Being out at the track on Friday caused my allergies to act up and I wound up paying $13 bucks for a 5 pack of 24 hour Claritin. The Candy Bars and Pop are also expensive in the gift shop. Heck, even the ATM had a steep charge. I do think, though, for this type of hotel in a downtown metropolitan area, that's just something you have to expect. My wife and I found our room to be very clean, comfortable and it had a great view of the plaza by the Simon Mall Headquarters. There was a flat screen TV, good selection of channels, a comfortable sitting chair, desk and a clean bathroom. The Starwood Hotels do an awesome job when it comes to the bed and bedding. No scratchy sheets or bedding, nice, soft and comfy. The beds themselves are fantastic. My wife though, thought the pillows were a little wimpy, and next time would bring her own. That Friday Night, we decided to stay in and get a pizza. When the pizza came, the pizza place forgot to give us napkins and plates. We called down and they brought us a couple of plates, one of which wasn't washed properly and had something on the bottom of it. The front desk also helped us with a list of restaurants and the front desk person was helpful with suggesting a couple of pizza places he thought were worthy of trying. On Saturday Night after exploring the Mall, seeing a movie (it was rainy till mid afternoon) and exploring downtown we returned to our room and the hotel had left us a bottle of wine and some chocolates with a little note from the hotel wishing us the best during our stay and expressing their hope that we'd have fun at the race Sunday. (I suspect they probably did this for everyone who was a guest of the Indy Convention Association.) I thought it was a very classy touch. And it wasn't a regular bottle of wine, the bottle had the All State 400 at the Brickyard logo on it. A very nice keep sake after enjoying the wine! We did want more than a taste of chocolate, so we opted for dessert from room service, which was not as good as we expected. Sunday was race day, so we were grateful to have a comfortable room to relax in after a long, fun day at the track. What I noticed and liked a lot about the hotel was it's location. There are many food and bar choices a short walk from the hotel. Lucas Oil Stadium, Conseco Fieldhouse, Victory Field are all walkable from the hotel. The Indy Zoo and White River State Park are probably walkable too, if you're a motivated walker. For the rest of us, a very, very short drive. My wife and I really enjoyed our comfortable room at the Westin, thought the staff was great, and a terrific weekend in a great, friendly city that has lots to offer. A couple of notes: If you're planning a trip to Indy do check out www.visitindy.com. The Indy Convention and Visitors Association can really help you plan a great getaway with their resources. Also, take a drive out to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and go to their museum. The Brickyard is an awesome site, whether you go for a race, or just to see the track and check out the museum it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Well presented hotel - Superb location !”
Reviews.Author: applestrudel
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a great weekend at the Westin. My husband booked this hotel for an Anniversary break as it was close to the Lucas Oil stadium where he had booked concert tickets, for the Saturday night. Once I knew the hotel, I logged straight on to trip advisor and the mixed comments really had me concerned. Getting to the Hotel. We didn’t really have any problems finding the hotel, it is located just off S. Capitol Ave on Washington Street. (opp the Capital State Building). Car Parking Not too sure what all the fuss is about regarding parking. Basically you have two options, self park for $25 a night. If you are using this option your car has to stay put for the duration of your stay. Should you wish to take your car out then use the valet parking at $28 a night. We chose the self-parking option and the entrance is easy enough to find, the car park is called Capital commons and just before the hotel. I know other hotels in the area are charging $32 plus a night for parking. For me living near Chicago, where parking is far more expensive I really did not have an issue with the parking rate. I felt my car was safe where it was parked and that was all that I cared about. Room. We had a gorgeous suite with sitting room, bedroom and bathroom. The décor was in calming shades of cream and green. Very serene and relaxing. The king size bed was heaven to sleep on. We felt as though we had full panoramic views of the Capitol state building and downtown Indi. Very clean, presentable room. The bathroom once again was well appointed, the only negative was that it was rather on the small side. But I loved the double showerhead and the illuminated vanity mirror. Towels were a little course but the bathrobes luxurious. Wi-fi Free in the reception area, although a fee to use in rooms. There is a business centre available, but once again a charge is made for that service. Location. For us the location was perfect, only a very short walk to the shops, restaurants and bars of downtown. The lucus Oil stadium only 10 minutes away and numerous museums very close by along with the central canal, which is a very enjoyable walk. The city was so accessible that we left our car in the lot and went everywhere on foot. Restaurants/Room Service We did not eat in any of the restaurants as we chose to dine in town. We took advantage of the room service for Breakfast. Eggs, Bacon, Hash Brown, Choice or bread, tea or coffee and fruit juice priced at $18.50 plus 18% service fee. We enjoyed breakfast and it was very well presented. Not the warmest breakfast I have ever eaten and maybe not the tastiest either and at a total of around $55 for two, I guess it was not the best value meal I have eaten!!! Negatives On our second day at the hotel, we were out all day and only returned to our room for one hour to get ready for the concert in the evening. This was at 4pm and we were surprised to see that our room had not been cleaned. We left for the concert and returned at 11;45 pm. Our room had still not been cleaned. I called down to reception and she was very helpful and apologetic, but it made me laugh when she asked me if I was sure that my room had not been cleaned! They offered to send a member of housekeeping up straight away, but at this time of the night I just wanted to get into bed so declined. Our bill the following day believe it or not was incorrect, not sure I have ever checked out of a hotel yet and not been overcharged, they were trying to charge me $7.80 for 2 bottles of water which had a complementary tag around their neck in our suite. Reception put the mistake right for us with no fuss. Summary I know we had a couple of problems, but I would stay at this hotel again without any hesitation. The public rooms and bedrooms were well appointed, beautiful décor and very clean. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and knowledgeable and the location could not have been more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone claims...”
Reviews.Author: mbucha4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Indy to catch a concert @ Conseco Fieldhouse. After reading many reviews on different sites about this hotel, I was a little worried. We got a steal for a room, so I couldn't pass it up. From reading reviews, we found out that you cannot get to the hotel entrance using a GPS if you put in '50 S Capitol Ave.' The entrance is actually on Washington. You can valet park for $28 overnight or self-park for $25. We were told that with the valet, you have in&out privileges, but with self-park you do not. We used the valet. The doormen were VERY helpful and polite, asking if we needed help, told us where to go, etc. Check-in went smooth, and we got the room that we had reserved. Upon entering our room, we found it to be clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are a little on the small side, and the mirror over the sink is a little small, but it served the purpose. The pool area was very nice, and although we were not traveling with kids, we noticed the pool is 4ft all the way around, not very kid-friendly. The fitness center was HUGE, the largest i've seen in a hotel. Not sure about the internet, we did not have a need for it. We used the skywalk to get to the mall, that was nice. The hotel location was wonderful, less than a 10 minute walk to Conseco Fieldhouse. Check out went smooth, and we did not have to wait long at all for the valet to bring our car around. Overall, the hotel was very nice, but I probably wouldn't have paid more than $130-$160 a night for a king size standard room. Yes, parking could be considered expensive, but it's the same in any big-city downtown location. Oh, and on some travel websites, you have the option to pay a little more for a "city/fountain view"....the city view would be nice if you care about that sort of thing, but the fountain wasn't working when we were there. Otherwise, you get a "nice" view of the Mariott behind the hotel, maybe some scenery on the sides, luckily view wasn't important to us. In the future, my husband and I would definitely stay at this hotel again- we had a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel EVERYTHING IS SOO EXPENSIVE HERE”
Reviews.Author: danigirl48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the westin because hotels.com showed it as being really nice for the money, and well YES is is like a 5 star hotel compared to where i stay, great location, but DAMN 25 dollars for parking each day, and the restraunt there for 2 cheeseburgers and kids chicken it was 55 bucks and sonic is better then those burgers. i never slept because all i heard all night where doors slamming shut and peopl talking. all the restraunts around this hotel were EXPENSIVE as well. The hotel was nice rooms were nice but to expensive for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price and worst service I ever received after reserving a room months in advance”
Reviews.Author: august31
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room with two double beds for the first weekend in August 7th& 8th. Prepaid at the time of reservation also. Called Saturday at 3pm to say I would be checking in later around 10pm was told no problem your room is already paid for. Arrived at 10:30 after drving around looking for 50 S. Capitol Ave. which is not the address you want to use for directions( would have been nice to know earlier.) Arrived to find no room available for us, had to wait in lobby for half an hour while one was being cleaned, having no choice we waited. The room was a suite, one king bed and a sofa sleeper. Not what I wanted , no one wants to sleep on a hide a bed. Filter in air conditioning vent was filthy, king bed was nice but definitely not worth what I paid for a room. Then I receive my credit card bill today and besides the 28.00 I had to pay to park for 9 hours, I have an extra charge of $5.86. I tried to call but if I want to find out what its for I must send an email to accounting and wait for a reply. Filled out a comment card and left it in the drop box at checkout have had no reply. Stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: agoodall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin during GenCon. The price was one-fifty-nine a night, plus taxes, obviously higher than "non-peak" times. The hotel is attached to the convention center, which helped out a lot, particularly as my wife had trouble walking great distances. They warned us about the minibar when we checked in, and we made sure not to touch anything in it. The pricing was high at $25 a day. We weren't going anywhere, so I didn't bother with valet parking. Regardless, they charged us valet parking even though we weren't in the valet section. They did remove this from our bill. They seem to have trouble with their elevators. I saw another review about people stuck in the elevator. This happened to us (a total of 12 of us), too. Unfortunately, our 10 year old was skittish about elevators and all the way up to Indy he asked if we would get stuck. Sure enough, we did. We ended up missing a dinner engagement as we tried to calm him down. What did the hotel do to compensate us, given that we got grease on our clothes from the rescue? They had water available, and they called to see if we were okay. That's it. I'm not sure what I expected, but a laundry service would have been nice at the very least. For the money, the hotel was absolutely nothing special. The beds were okay, but the padded cover is not elasticized and kept riding up on me at night. The bathroom was an okay size, maybe a little on the small size. The big cost ripoff is their wireless internet. It's free if you log in on the first two floors (well, the first floor, anyway) and ten dollars for the privilege of checking your e-mail from your room. Why they nickel and dime you on this is beyond me. I had to traipse down to the lobby every night to check e-mail. The free internet is free for 24 hours. You can renew, but once I tried to renew on the 2nd floor (having connected for free from the second floor) and it wouldn't let me in. I had to go to the first floor, disconnect from that server then reconnect before it let me in again. Totally unnecessary, and just another way of gouging you. The lobby looks nice, but behind the nice lobby is an average hotel with high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but some snafus”
Reviews.Author: JenRae
Reviews.Content: This hotel has decent rooms that are comfortable. Had some problems in knowing where to park our car. One valet tried to tell us we couldn't park in a certain area, but then two others said we could. Didn't like the hefty price of $25 per night to park. We had a Club Floor room, and their breakfast offerings were very nice with courteous staff. Overall, was please and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off do not stay”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock1656
Reviews.Content: I paid for 9 days in advance. Due to the death of mother in law arrived later than expected. They had charged my credit card and re sold the room to someone else. They got paid twice for the same room for the whole 9 days. They refuse to refund any portion of my payment!! Howeve I did find accomadations at the LaQuinta on Post road and found the staff wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One horrible thing after another”
Reviews.Author: kerbear737
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat, things did not go well. My directions told me the hotel was off S. Capitol...so I ended up circling a very busy block (it was Black Expo when we went and the traffic and pedestrian traffic was understandably busy at that time) about 4 times before I figured out that the hotel entrance is actually off Washington instead. Every single one of my friends said they had the same problem. Check-in was ok, but when we got to our room we discovered that our sink was leaking water everywhere on the counter. When we called the front desk for maintenance we discovered that the battery in our phone was dead and the only way to get ahold of someone was on speakerphone. We were told someone would be right up. A maintenance man did come to our room while we were headed out for the evening, but when we returned, the faucet was still broken and leaking. When we called again, they said someone would be right up. An hour later...nothing. At this point, the faucet was so bad it wouldn't even shut off, so for about an hour we just had the water running constantly because the faucet would not shut off. When we called a third time, the maintenance man came and did fix the faucet, but he said we wouldn't have any hot water on that side and that we'd have to climb under the sink and wrap a towel around the pipe or something because a part was missing. Um, what? During this time, my friend was still waiting for her bag to be brought up from the valet....nothing. She called the desk and was told "we'll bring it right up"...without even asking for her valet # or what the bag looked like! Needless to say, the front desk did NOTHING and she finally gave up and went down to the parking garage herself to get her own bag. (On a side note, the parking fee was ridiculous and the hallways were dark and had filthy dirty carpet.) We did not even attempt to try to go to sleep until around 2 AM...partially because of the insane amount of noise in the hallway from the other guests. I understand it was a particularly busy time in Indianapolis with the Expo going on and that the hotel was booked to capacity. But I'm sorry, people running and screaming and talking and slamming doors ALL NIGHT LONG is ridiculous. We called to complain several times but absolutely nothing was done, even though we were assured that they had a "full security staff"...where were they? Could they not just periodically walk the hall to maintain peace and some semblance of decorum? We got no sleep all night. This hotel has a responsibility to all of its guests. It's clear that, even though Indianapolis is home to several large conventions and tourist events like the IBE, no advance planning was taken to ensure that the hotel was able to operate efficiently, especially for those guests not necessarily there for the event. Service was the worst I have ever experienced at any hotel....and was especially disappointed in this from a 4-star Westin. When we complained AGAIN about our long list of problems we had...we were given an obviously rehearsed but insincere apology and were told that we would have to call or email the manager. He wasn't even AVAILABLE! I'm sure he was hiding from all the guests. We could not have been the only ones with problems there. The bottom line is that we paid a lot of money for services we did NOT receive. We paid for a place to sleep....we did not sleep. We paid for a place to use the facilites...those facilities were broken. We paid for a reasonable about of service from the hotel staff....we got blown off and waved away. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and I emphatically suggest no one else does either.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: 14clubs
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight to attend a wedding. Registration was friendly and welcoming. Room was perfect with a view of the capitol and rest of downtown. Plenty of towels, high end amenities, real water glasses. Parking valets were always prompt, friendly, and efficient. All what you would expect from a Westin. Everything in downtown and the convention center is within walking distance. Two or three blocks max. If we go back to Indianapolis, we'd definitely consider the Westin. On the downside, and not just specific to the Westin, internet and parking are extra charges. At least the Westin valet parking is much more reasonable ($28) than other hotels close by. P.S. We read other reviews and the warnings about the "refreshment center". When we checked in, I looked it over carefully and saw that ours had a sign/menu on it specifically stating it was that and not a refrigerator. Maybe the others didn't see the sign or it was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: siucarnpb
Reviews.Content: Visiting for the summer from California, decided to get a room for the delayed fire works, since we could see them from this hotel if it rained again. Check in was fast and easy, but got a big surprise when I left the hotel to pick a friend up. The parking garage that the hotel has a sign out for is 25$ after 3 hrs with no in out privileges. Nothing was said to me. I argued with the front desk about waving the valet charges, which they did after 10mins of yelling. 25$ in indy to park, I pay that in San Francisco,. So make sure to valet park as it is on 28$ a day. The rooms are nice ( westin room ), but the hotel is showing it's age.

Reviews.Title: “Not great service”
Reviews.Author: Louisville-Lindsay
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. The place was slightly outdated, but the location was nice. I was very unhappy that nothing was done by the manager or hotel when myself and 9 other people had to be rescued from an elevator. We were stuck for 45 minutes and the manager did get our room numbers but did nothing to compensate us. I thought in the very least we would have received a phone call to check on us.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: 3duckdave
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of the Indy Downtown Westin i was a little nervous about my travel plans. I booked the room through Hotwire.com, and got a great deal. As mentioned in a previous review the address is a bit deceiving. The main entrance isn't on Capitol Ave. at all, it's half a block west of Capitol Ave. So if you are approaching from the north get in the far right lane and prepare to turn right on either Washington or Maryland. Yes parking is $25 per night in the closest garage, but you pay this in just about any garage in downtown Indy or any other major city for that matter. Check in was a breeze, walked in stated my name, I was asked what kind of bed I preferred and handed my key cards, and shown to the elevator. We had room #1107, it is a corner room with a modest north facing view. The room is probably a little narrower than most, since it is a corner room and there were 3 rooms at the end of the hallway. Two corners and a middle. The room did have a stuffy smell upon entering, but once the air conditioning ran for a short while the stuffiness dissipated. No stains on the carpet or furniture. The room had a table/desk setup with internet connections and a phone. It had a HD flat screen TV, presumably LCD, I don't remember, roughly in the 40 inch class. The "Heavenly Bed" was wonderful, it didn't however keep me from snoring, much to the dismay of my girlfriend. She also enjoyed the bed very much. The "Heavenly Shower" was also great, good water pressure and plenty of hot water for each of us to take a shower in the morning. The bathroom sink also spit out instant hot water. The in room vending machine IS NOT A REFRIGERATOR!! The card inserted in the top of the door states this and even goes so far to inform you any accidental movement of the items inside may result in charges for those items moved. We forgot about this and moved a orange juice to make room for a water bottle and at 2:30 am we got a bill for $3.90 for the orange juice. So don't touch anything in their unless you intend to eat or drink whatever you touch. All in all it's a good place to stay in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little over priced. Go to Priceline and get it for $80.”
Reviews.Author: sorency
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and 2 year old went to Indy for a buisness meeting and to go to the childrens museum. I checked the room rate online and it was 228 (wow) tooo expensive. So I went to priceline and got the room for 80 per night (better). I called the hotel while on the road to find out if there was anyway that we could check in early because our 2 year old was fussy. NO PROBLEM. We were allowed to check in at 9am. GREAT. Check was a breeze and my daughter was greeted by a childs bag that included a night light, first aid kit, child socket covers and a rubber duck. Then we went to our room and the bed was very comfortable, but the bathroom was a little small. So, while my daughter took a nap I was looking at all of the hotel amentities. They brought us a small potty for my daughter that played music, a step stool so she could get on the bed without any assistance, and a extra robe for my husband. The list of extras were a mile long. Also if your children are getting a little restless before dinner you can go to lobby around 5p and they offer fruit, cheese and crackers. The pool was ok, it did not have stairs (just ladders). The work out room was nice but if your kids have to use the restrooms when using the pool they have to go through the workout room to get to the restroom. The floor was slippery and a little uncomfortable to have to walk through the workout room to use the restroom when you are soaking weat. The childrens museum is about 3 miles away. There are plenty of resturants, movie theaters, shopping and sports venues close to the hotel. Also there is a skywalk that can take you plenty of places. Hotel was difficult to find on the GPS but we found it after going around the blocks a couple of times. Parking was expensive. Breakfast was delivered on time in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillybean2
Reviews.Content: OK. Let me start off by saying this hotel is not up to Westin standards and I would not pay the rack rate of $259 a night for this hotel. Now having said that, this was a nice hotel. We paid $76 dollars a night , the beds were very comfortable, service was excellent. I didn't wait for my car, the staff always had a smile, held elevators, etc. The valet parking is 28$ a night, but you are in the downtown of a city. That's pretty standard in my experience. We walked pretty much everwhere because of it's very central location. I really don't understand all of the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on business, and I wanted to stay downtown rather than out in the 'burbs. No problems or complaints, but it also was nothing exceptional. Staff I encountered were friendly and helpful. The lobby and facilities were nice but my room seemed less luxurious than the usual Westin experience. The location is great -- adjacent to a conference center and other hotels, and across the street from the state capitol. Several restaurants are a block or two away. Check-in was effortless, though I had to wait a few minutes for someone to appear. My king room was quite small, but functional and very quiet. Bathroom was small but well-lit. A separate closet was very dark. Internet access was $10/night. A basic fitness center is located on the 3rd floor with cardio machines, some free weights and a lap pool. There is no locker room. Valet parking was $28/night; self-park in the adjacent garage is $25.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: pinball29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. It is just OK. Physically, the room I stayed in was small and looked out onto a cavelike enclosure but I hear there are different rooms. The bathroom is tiny, (you have to shut the door to use the toilet) and I was provided w/ one small bar of soap on checkin. Got an additonal bar when the housekeeper made up the room after the first nite. Being a Westin, the bed was great, as it always is. There are very few dining options (basically one, Shulas steakhouse) but a short walk will put you in the middle of a mall-like area w/ many restaurants There is a 'Champions' in the Marriott next door that is a better option for cheaper eats. Room service is shockingly expensive, w/ a 3.50 service charge and a 21% (!!) gratuity tacked on to very high menu prices. Youll pay about 30.00 for a basic egg breakfast. Dont even touch anything in the minibar, or youll be charged whether you eat/drink it or not. Dont even open it. I found the staff very accomodating, esp the shipping dept and the catering/meeting services dept. For a business class hotel, I was surprised at how substandard it was to a typical Marriott or Hyatt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL. Miserable, Rude Service.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11235
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend stayed there for a conference over Valentines Day. I sent her a present Priority Mail. I called the hotel before sending it to see if I needed any special information for the package to get to her. They said just her name. Don't worry. She never got it. Three weeks have now passed and I've been calling them every day to find someone who'll look for the package and return my call to tell me what they found. I've found the staff, rude, curt, nasty, disrespectful and profoundly unprofessional. don't stay there and whatever you do, don't send anyone something of value there. The staff will lose it and then accuse you of never having sent it.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: photocellist
Reviews.Content: This Westin must primarily serve folks visiting the area on business. It's connected to the convention center by a skywalk which was nice during January. Upon arrival, my room smelled of cigarette smoke. It was obvious that a neighbor was smoking. I called down and was told that the entire hotel is non smoking. Thankfully, they assigned a new room for me without delay. Hopefully they found the culprit. Because it must cater to business folks, I am surprised at the mediocre service and quality of certain room details. While I found everyone at the hotel friendly and professional, I wasn't happy with the late room servicing (my room was never serviced before 4pm). The hotel has thin walls as I could easily hear neighbors talking, alarm clocks going off and people going up and down the hall. It made for poor sleep. The bathroom is small--can't imagine more than 2 people sharing a room. The room temperature was hard to control and caused some discomfort. The bed was very comfortable--the best part of the room. Like other reviewers, I was charged for items from the minibar. I never opened the minibar--I don't even know what was in it. I asked to have the charges removed and my request was met with reluctance. If I return for business in the future, I will be sure to try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horriffic Experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lp8
Reviews.Content: Terrible is an understatement!! Checking in was only the beginnng of my horrific nightmare. After check-in I went out to find my car had been taken by the valet WITH THE LUGGAGE IN IT!!! The valet instructed me to go to the garage and my luggage would be waiting. It was waiting...still in the back of the car with NO LUGGAGE CART and my room was on the 11th floor. We finally got the cart and luggage to our room only to find a dark hallway and musty smelling room. The view was a dark alley and very disappointing. Upon waiting for a bell-hop my phone fell behind the dresser and I discovered a condom on the floor!!! OMG....my daughter (10 yrs old) asked many questions and I had no answers appropriate for a 10 yr old. It took over an hour to get this removed and when turning down the bed for the night we discovered dried blood on the pearly white comforter!!! OMG...I was appauled!!! I called and the housekeeping staff came and changed the bed, only to find a huge urine stain on the mattress and no mattress pad! After MUCH complaining we were upgraded to a larger room and free breakfast. As many other guests have noted we were also charged for the mini bar,,,,,$111.00 and we didn't eat anything out of it. We had moved a few things to keep our milk cold in the refreshment center since there wasn't a refrig in the room. The valet parking was $56.00 for a 2 nights stay and wasn't worth it. After all of my trouble we were only compensated with a room upgrade, free breakfast and a few additional points added to our starwood guest card. NEVER NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: mombilt
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courtious and the check-in ws breeze. The room was very average for a westin. We stayed 3 nights. On the 2nd and 3rd day we came in after being gone from about10 til 4p.m. to find our room not cleaned. We complained on the last evening when we got home at 11:30 pm to again find our room not cleaned. We had to call earlier at around 4p.m. to ask for the service. The manager brought clean towels, shampoo and toilet paper but never apologized and didnt even take our 2 days worth of dirty towels that we had neatly piled at the door. We will be coming back to Indy next yr but wont be staying at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Stay problematic”
Reviews.Author: MsZie
Reviews.Content: Difficult to access-centered on two one way roads. Valet parking is inefficient. Average wait to get car > 15 minutes- even when calling ahead. First time retrieving car took 25 minutes and made me late for an important meeting. Room was average. Cost money to use business center. Internet in room cost fee and was inoperable. One of two phones broken. Lightbulbs out. In town on business- stay at hotel obviously plagued by problems. Prefer the Crowne Plaza and Omni- in that order.

Reviews.Title: “Once we found it we loved it”
Reviews.Author: klittrell
Reviews.Content: Several families stayed at the Westin the weekend of Nov. 15th for my daughter's wedding. We loved it, very clean, very modern, very friendly. Only problem was finding it as the address states that it is on Capitol Ave but the check-in is actually nearer to Maryland Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and Disorganized”
Reviews.Author: MovieDoug
Reviews.Content: I have traveled and stayed at Westin properties all around the world. This one by far is the worst one. The valet service was very disorganized, rude and unprofessional. Lost keys were a daily occurrence. Waiting more than 20 minutes is the norm. They have the largest driveway I have ever seen at a Westin Property, but they still will not allow you to call down and have the car pulled out and ready for you, so you must go downstairs, give them your number and wait. The bathrooms were substandard for Westin Properties, smaller than normal and the A/C electrical outlets were placed by the door near the floor, which means if you were using a hair drier, you would have to crouch down by the door without a mirror. The mirrors were skinny and small. I would not recommend this property until the staff goes through some training !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Slippery Showers”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located downton within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and historic monuments. Upon arrival we valeted the car ($28/day) and had lunch at Shula's (they made us special sandwiches since we were both vegetarians and there were no other lunch options offered. The hotel is average looking inside, the showers are very slippery and no bath mats are put down. My sister and I btoh fell when we used the shower. Management brought a pack of ice and a bath mat, but you would think next time they would keep these mats out just to keep people safe. The club lounge left something to be desired. Overall it was an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High overrated”
Reviews.Author: joecr5
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Westin in Downtown Indianapolis because we were having our bathroom redone and needed a place to stay with running water. We found a good price on Hotwire and decided to book it and it turned out to be the Westin. When we arrived, the valet was prompt and very courteous. Check-in was a breeze with no problems at all. The room itself was average. It was rather clean, however, it was an older room from the looks of it. There was some water damage (dark spots and possible mold) on the ceiling above the shower. There were no fitted sheets on the double beds, only flat sheets. With that said, the sheets were clean and the room didn't smell particularly bad. We did realize that you absolutely have to pay for everything, even internet access, which is 9.95 a day. There is also a stocked refrigerator with all kinds of stocked goodies for outrageous prices (can of coke was 4.00 + 21% service charge). The real problem began when I went to purchase 2 bottles of coke from the vending machine in the ice room. It conveniently did not take dollar bills (I had one dollar bill and 4 quarters for a 2.00 bottle of coke). So I went down to the front desk to get change for a 5.00 dollar bill so I could try the machine on the floor down. I went back up to the 12th floor (the floor which I say staying) and tried the coke machine another time just to make sure it wasn't working and it wasn't. I proceeded to the 11th, 10th, and 9th floor, and each coke machine didn't take dollar bills at all. I went back down to the lobby to see if I could get 16 quarters (for 2 20oz drinks out of the vending machine). I waited in line for 10 minutes because there was only one attendant on duty (which was very understaffed since there was a huge FFA convention in town). When it was my turn and I asked for some quarters, he let me know they did not have any quarters, he gave an excuse because they were busy. I said it was awfully convenient that none of the coke machines worked and it was basically forcing me to purchase a 4.00 can of coke out of the stocked refrigerator. I was very perturbed at the time and asked that he comp. a can of coke from our refrigerator for my troubles of having to come down twice because of problems with the hotel's equipment. He stood there and said that he couldn't do that. By this time it was after midnight and I was tired and all I wanted was a drink. I asked him why he couldn't comp my room a 40 cents can of coke. After 5 minutes of arguing he finally agreed to comp the can of coke. I know it seems silly to get so upset over a drink, but it was the mere fact that none of the coke machines worked, and I am lead to believe they don't work for a reason, and the fact that the attendant argued with a guest over a 4.00 can of coke (which they paid around 40 cents for). However, I checked my final bill in the morning and everything was correct. I have also noticed I have small bites on my body, I cannot assume they are from the beds in the hotel. However, they were not there before I stayed there. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “They charge you for everything!”
Reviews.Author: cheesegromit
Reviews.Content: We thought we got a good deal through Hotwire ($69 for a Saturday night). That deal quickly went out the window when we found out that they charge $9.95/day for wireless internet access. They do not include any sort of breakfast with the room price, but you can order 2 eggs for $17. You could grab a little snack from the mini-fridge at $3 for a candy bar. Then when we left the next day, we got kicked in the nuts again as they charged $25 for parking in their parking garage overnight! We won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: soon2bjweave
Reviews.Content: We booked an King Executive Suite for our wedding night back in January of 2008. Due to the Kenny Chesney concert and MotoGP in town this weekend we had been unable to reserve a room for just one night, but we found this on Expedia and were very happy with the accommodations. The room faced the state house on the 5th floor and had a separate seating room facing the Simon building. The bed was very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. The bathroom was a bit small, but the room made up for it by being very spacious. The hotel front desk was very accommodating in allowing my husband to check in (and early at that), even though the reservation was under my name because it was our wedding day. All in all it was a great stay and we would choose the Westin again if we had to house guests downtown in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: betch78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin while I was in town on business. I am surprised at the negative comments on this site, since my stay was very pleasant. The service was wonderful (very friendly), especially since it was an extremely busy weekend for them. (The first regular season Colts game of the year & the Chicago Bears were staying at the hotel.) And I don't know how you could beat the location -- near the stadium, Circle Centre Mall, Convention Center & the beautiful capitol building. Sure, I've stayed at more luxurious hotels, but I have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star....”
Reviews.Author: mcgillicutty
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip at the Westin through Priceline and paid $60/night. If I'd had paid full price I would have been very angry. The property seems to be very run down. Definitley not to Westin standards. My husband and I stayed at the property about 7 years ago and it was great, but nothing has been updated. The hallway's are in need of updating and repair. The toiletries offered in the bathroom are sparse (a bar of soap and a lotion). You would expect more from a 4 Star Westin. The bed sheets had holes, the lamp shades were cracked and on wrong. And BEWARE, the bathrooms are BEYOND tiny. Another thing to keep in mind is that the hotel charges you $50/per day of your stay for incidentals (which was never mentioned to us). Most hotels generally just put an initial hold on your card at check-in. This may be an issue for some people. We did get room service one morning and it was delicious and really fast. Overall, we were mildly satisfied with our stay. The Marriott just next door is beyond nice and newly remodeled. If you are going to pay full price I would HIGHLY recommend a newly remodeled room at the Marriott. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Location is what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fourforfun
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, but I expected more for a Westin. They didn't do housekeeping two days of my week-long stay and I had to call late at night to have towels brought up. I was disappointed, but the beds were great, and the proximity to the convention center was worth the poor housekeeping issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jerzamat
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Priceline. I priceline Downtown Indy all the time. First time at the Westin for $65/night. Great hotel. Very clean, modern, comforting. Room was great. Great bed! Starbucks on site. Great location downtown w/in walking distance of many restaurants & things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Nickel and Dimey”
Reviews.Author: kdmr
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong this hotel is in a great location in the city and has the Heavenly Bed which is usually a very pleasant experience. I have a very specific issue with this hotel and others following this trend - I was disappointed by the hotels approach to in-room expenses. My room had not one, but two, minibars. It also had the required bottle of water, available to you at charge, on top of the minibar. This bottle however was on top of a sensor and if moved placed the water charge on your hotel bill. When staying at a higher quality level of hotel I expect to not be faced with cheap attempts to get my money. If I drink a bottle of water, fine charge me for that act. Do not make me come down to the front desk and explain that I accidently bumped the bottle and put it back on its sensor and I shouldn't be charged. It is an annoyance and an action I would expect from a far lower class of establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: notoriouslrg
