Reviews.Content: The Westin is great. We were able to walk to any place in downtown in minutes. The hotel staff was more than wonderful they were great. The rooms offer a great view of downtown. The only problem we had were the other guest. We met two of the rudest ladies (if you can call them that) ever. The beds were so comfortable!!!! Bathrooms were clean and there are duel shower heads. Our entire group had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with the Westin Indianapolis room 1227”
Reviews.Author: vickisachicken
Reviews.Content: The weekend we stayed at the Westin was a very busy weekend but the staff got us checked in fast [and checkout was faster] and were fairly friendly. The "No Name Lounge" was a nice and relaxing place to sit and have a few drinks. The weather was rainy so the skywalk that connects to the mall was GREAT to have!! I read a few reviews before going to the Westin and was on the fence about what to expect. I would have to say I was definately NOT impressed by this hotel. It was very NICE to look at...but the rooms [and bathrooms] are definately on the small side. We had a few problems with the toilet-after about 5 flushes it wouldnt fill...and the double showerhead-i had to screw the 2nd one back on...also the sink would "gargle" in the middle of the night... The "Heavenly" bed was not as comfy as everyone claims it is...but thats my opinion...TOO SOFT...and there was almost no substance to the pillows at all... Our mini bar was not stocked when we got there...and they didnt fill it when they came to check it...but we went up to the Lounge for drinks [not too pricey but still steep for a bottle of beer]. The housekeepers came around way to early for my taste...9am is a bit early for a "stayover"...we were up and ready...but if i was sleeping I would have been upset! Great location for sure...but overall i think the rooms are a bit expensive for what you get...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Westin Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: KerryWho?
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read the previous reviews here and noted several critical of the accomodations. However, our overnight stay here was very pleasant. Professional and helpful staff, clean and quiet room, a "heavenly" bed, and great location to downtown attractions. We valet parked our car ($25 for overnight, which is typical for downtown metropolitan parking almost everywhere) and the valet service was extremely helpful and accomodating to our needs (having car ready when needed, placing luggage in car while we went for breakfast, etc.). The check in procedure was effortless (though the desk clerk could have smiled a bit) as was our express check out. The rooms were also nicely furnished, and did not appear to be old or outdated as some previous reviews mentioned. We did not have time to sample the restaurant offerings at Shula's Steakhouse, but walked through and thought it looked quite inviting. One tip: Don't use the smart bar (mini-bar) unless you plan to pay big bucks for junk food and beverages. The hotel is in the process of replacing the mini-bars with "sensor detection" type smart bars. So, don't even think of opening them (for use in placing medicine, etc. for refrigeration purposes). You are asked to contact the front desk to get a mini-refrigerator if you need to refrigerate items in the room. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Milkaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for three nights while attending a conference. My room was lovely and clean and quiet. The rest of this review probably won't be helpful for the typical traveler (unless you tend to forget things like I do)... But I'm going to share since I think it speaks to the trustworthiness of some of the staff there. After I flew back home and unpacked my bags, I remembered that I left my jewelry in the safe deposit box (unlocked). I called the hotel at 1am and the operator informed me that someone was already using the room. They transferred me to the security office, and the man on duty said he'd check it out and call me back. I didn't get a call by the next afternoon, so I called the operator again. The security person that I spoke with this time quickly checked out the room, and I got a call within 10 minutes from the hotel's shipping department - they sent me my jewelry within two days. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms need updating.”
Reviews.Author: cprussel
Reviews.Content: The Westin downtown is located in the heart of Indianapolis. Very close to all of the hotspots. This is a great hotel. Our room however was not that great. The hallways and room were dated and in need of refreshing, Refrigerator in the room was setting in an awkward place and electrical wiring was strewn about and looked tacky, Overall a good stay for the money. Parking as always for a downtown hotel was $24 a night. Much better hotels can be found at this star level, but we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Usually good but poor response this time”
Reviews.Author: runningwoman
Reviews.Content: I go to Indy frequently for business and usually stay at the Westin because of the little touches like the relaxing white tea fragrance that hits you as soon as you enter the lobby and the massage/fruit/cheese "happy hour" they provide on certain nights. My stays usually go without a hitch and my room is usually set to go and clean. This time I happened to be typing at the desk when an enormous cockroach crawled up my arm. I killed it with my wallet (wasn't thinking clearly enough to just use the pad of paper nearby) and called the front desk to let them know that I had found a cockroach. Usually when you find one there's probably a few more of their friends just around the bend. When the shift manager came up, he just removed the offender and offered to (had to) move me so that they could fumigate the room and the rooms next door. Instead of being moved up to a similar or better room, I was brought to a room that wasn't on the club floor and had a broken chair. No other concessions. sadly he was more concerned that I might tell our company's meeting planner (we use their conference rooms for meetings quite often) and asked to confirm the name of our meeting planner so that he could let him know that it was taken care of. The manager only offered measly points only after I had asked what else they could do and gave me the excuse that they can't do much about the cockroaches because people bring food into the room and it's out of their control. I was surprised at how he ignored that this could be seen as a symptom of serious sanitary conditions in the rooms. When I walked into a room at a Marriott that didn't have a clean toilet, they gave me a free dinner at their restauraunt and a enough points for a free stay in the future and acknowledged that it was not acceptable and apologized profusely. It's too bad the Westin handled it the way they did seeing as how most hotels go out of their way for their members with status. Still waiting to hear a response from them. Until I do I'm planning on staying at the Conrad or the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: racegrrl
Reviews.Content: We had a trade show in Indianapolis to attend, so I used Priceline to see if we could get a deal and boy we did! We ended up with the Westin - which couldn't have been more perfect as they have a skywalk to the convention center where our event was being held. We were so pleased with getting the Westin for the price we paid as the location was perfect and our stays with Westin in the past have always been terrific. This time was no exception though we were not in the room as much as we typically are. Check in was 3 pm, but we were allowed to check in 1 1/2 hours early. Very nice man at the front desk. We parked in the garage next to the hotel - very convenient but pricy - $24 for 24 hours. There are garages that are less expensive for overnight, but you will have to walk a few blocks. We paid for the convenience and it was worth it. Our room was on the 12th floor looking west toward the Marriott. Room 1203 was nicely appointed, two double beds, chair, desk, tv, minibar (don't even touch anything unless you want to be charged for it!), hair dryer, safe, iron and board, lighted vanity mirror. Bathroom was nice, a bit small, and a bit too dark for our taste. But there are two mirrors in the main part of the room, so other than shaving, anything else can be done out there in the daylight. Only other negative was the drain in our tub - very slow. Water was up to my ankles when I finished with my shower, not a deal breaker, but an inconvenience. The best part of the room - the beds. Oh my goodness, they are exactly what they call them: HEAVENLY! My Alex enjoyed one of the best nights sleep he has ever had away from home! They are firm and soft at the same time, and are just perfect. The location of the hotel to all that's fun in downtown Indy makes it a perfect place to stay. Two blocks from the City Centre mall, lots of restaurants right down the street, a half block from the Capitol building, across the street from the Indiana Convention Center and the RCA Dome . . . it's all right at your fingertips! We also found the best breakfast place about 6 blocks away - LePeep on the corner of Illinois and New York streets. The best pancakes in all of Indy! Check out was a breeze since we had no charges to the room. A few steps to the elevator which took us to the parking garage and we were on our way in less than 5 minutes from front desk to leaving the garage. Very convenient. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, especially if we were going to any event in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “The best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: t2andc2
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at the Westin in Indy; however, it was a great night. The Heavenly beds are just that....heavenly. They are the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever stayed in! The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: dknelson
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good condition, seems to be understaffed. On check-in there was a big bag of smelly garbage by my door, when I came back 4 hrs. later, it was still there. As I was checking out they had ONE guy acting as the bellhop and valet. He said because an event at the RCA center was letting out my car was blocked in (not true--I checked, but couldn't drive my car without keys). As it turned out, there was some professional basketball team also checking out at the same time. Although I was first in line, it seems that they took precedent because: A) He anticipated a larger tips? B) They are more important than me? C) ???? So this ONE guy went up and down the elevator for each player until the their bus was packed with all their bags. Wait for my car: 1 hr. + If you're not a sports celebrity, get ready to feel like a VUP at the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hohohaha
Reviews.Content: I spent a day at this hotel for Christmas party. Arrived at the hotel a little after 9AM, and was gladly accepted to check-in early. A bit of late check out was also accepted. Overall quite pleasant stay. Check in/out: Even though check in was 9AM, I was able to check-in. Asked late check out at 1PM, and it was also very pleasantly accpeted. Room: Is a bit outdated. Although the "Heavenly Bed" was really nice and comfy. Found a refreshment center which was locked. Thought it was mini fridge and refreshement center but found out that there is no mini fridge. Asked mini fridge and it was brought up a bit late. Had also trouble with chair, and asked replacement. Air conditioning was a bit old, and sound a bit odd. Bathroom: Need improvement immediately. Quite old, and noisy. Also, need to wait a while to get real "hot" water. Overall: Nice stay but the hotel need to make some "renovation" or "improvement" of its facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: oshtemo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay for a conference and felt this was a good downtown hotel if you're in town for business. I thought the conference rate was very good; $110 nightly. The room was fine; good work area with comfortable chair and internet access. Clean and well maintained. The bed was definately "heavenly", probably the big selling point for this hotel. I thought the bathroom was very small, but enjoyed the dual shower heads. The staff was efficient and professional. No one was rude but I didn't get a real friendly vibe either. Didn't eat at their signature restaurant, Shula's, way out of my price range. But they are connected to the mall and plenty of more affordable eating options there. You are also within walking distance of some decent quality restaurants that won't break the bank. Overall I can recommend this hotel if you can get a pretty decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Need to work on room maintenence and housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: Normally I am a big fan of Westin's. However, I was deeply disappointed in the cleanlyness at this Westin. I actually had to switch rooms for a very disgusting incident in the first room. They did quickly move me to another room, but that one had issues as well. They really need to work on room maintenence and housekeeping. The service was OK, but nothing exceptional. The lobby was cold and drafty. Would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelure27
Reviews.Content: Consistent Westin level quality, but nothing extraordinary. My experience with housekeeping, room service, & front desk was great. Only complaint- The bathroom lights were extremely dim in my room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the bed”
Reviews.Author: muffyf
Reviews.Content: Very nice Westin. I loved that there was a real comforter and not a gross bedspread. There was a Christian Teenagers Conference going on at the hotel the weekend I was there but they were pretty well behaved and quiet. Conceirge was really helpful and staff were very nice. It is about a 30 minute drive from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin was in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sister003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin during a conference. It is in a great location, within walking distances to most of the city. The room was nice and the beds were great! The lighting in the bathroom was horrible.....I like bright lights in a bathroom. There was a washcloth from the previous person still hanging on the shower curtain. I thought that was sort of gross. Other than that, I would probably stay here again if I am ever in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but no Westin”
Reviews.Author: josiecat
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are pretty true - decent place, but not the usual Westin quality hotel. With the exception of the Heavenly Bed (R), you'd never know that you are at one. Service was OK - traveled for business and was not able to check in when I had arrived (1pm). This was tough since the afternoon schedule was booked. I had to head back down to the lobby (with the rest of the convention folk) and wait in line a few hours later. I would have expected this to be coordinated if they cater to conferences. I didn't have shampoo in the room when I got there (important for traveling in the carry-on age) and didn't get any until I made multiple calls. Good location - close to everything downtown. I would stay there again, but wouldn't be too thrilled about it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: digby32
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Rooms are small and very dated. Hotel needs an emergency facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-standard service, noisy”
Reviews.Author: TripBlazer
Reviews.Content: The Westin Indianapolis has aspirations of being an upscale hotel, but doesn't know how to do it. The property itself is nice, and the location is great -- right across the street from the state capitol and near all of the restaurants and sights in the downtown area. But they need to upgrade and enter the 21st century. Note to the Westin: Hotels don't charge for Internet access anymore, especially when that access is spotty at best. I spent most of my stay trying to get the hard-wired Internet connection to work. After two visits from technical help with no luck, I gave up and used the wireless access -- which ranged from slow to none. I had flashbacks to my dial-up days. A place like this should have flawless high-speed Internet access for free. Period. Instead, I paid ten bucks a day for slow wireless access that died out frequently. The hotel suggested I request a small in-room refrigerator rather than use the honor bar, but when I did request it they didn't deliver it. So I asked again. No luck. A third call. No refrigerator. Finally, after an irate fourth call, I got the refrigerator. So the place has some technical and service issues. Finally, as always, I had the room across from the loud family, who apparently booked two adjacent rooms and spent the entire evening -- til 1:00 am -- opening and closing each door so they could go back and forth. It sounded like they were opening the doors right next to my bed. A little soundproofing would be helpful -- expecting courtesy from one's fellow guests is, of course, a thing of the past.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: Juilletdix
Reviews.Content: I had some meetings in Indy and decided to go up the day before. I used Starpoints to get a free night here. I think the rate was close to $200/night, so I'm glad I got it for free. We drove up from Chicago. Self-parking at the hotel is $12 with validation. The room was pretty nice. Westin beds are always nice, so that was a plus. We got a room with a nice view - part of which was the rooftop swimming pool. Unfortunately, we did not have time to check that out, but it looked very nice. We had dinner in the bar, service was pleasant but a little inept. There was another couple sitting next to us, we were all trying to watch the Bears game on the big flat screen - and the bar had the easy listening music on the sound system cranked way up. I asked the server if he could do something, seeing as how the only customers there (10:30pm on a Sunday) were trying to watch the game. He said he didn't know how. Eventually, a manager came by and turned it down, but by then, we were ready to call it a night. The next morning, the sounds of a jackhammer greeted us. The property used to be a Radisson and I guess they are renovating. Anyway, this would have been a problem if we'd been staying more than one night. My Starwood status got me a late (4PM) checkout, but my meetings went super late and it was closer to 6pm before we got back to check out. I called the hotel around 4:30, once I realized that we wouildn't be back in time and they were quite gracious about the whole thing. I was worried I would get charged for this, but they just waved it off, which was really nice. It's a nice enough place - I'd check on the status of the renovation before staying again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for the water charge”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Westin downtown Indianapolis the night of July 21. We stayed thanks to Priceline and paid $80 for the night. We had a great room, #911. It's on the front side of the hotel & faced into downtown. The Capitol was to our left, the Simon office directly in front of us, the Hyatt behind that, and the Convention Center to our right. The view was pretty decent, but Indy isn't that pretty of a city so whatever. The front desk worker made it out to be something spectacular when we checked in. My biggest gripe with this hotel was the parking. To park in the Westin garage is something like $25, with no in & out privileges (not something I've experienced at other area hotels). The other issue is that the location isn't the greatest on the block. The address is on Capitol Ave, but since Simon built their new place you can't actually see the hotel until you have passed it. All of the pretty pictures that Westin has on their website are obviously from the pre-Simon days when you could see the hotel from Capitol. In order to enter the hotel driveway you have to turn right from Capitol to Washington, and then take a pretty quick left to the hotel. The garage for the hotel has entrances on Washington & Maryland, right about in the middle of the block. The issue we had was that since there was a large convention (final weekend of Black Expo '07) it was hard enough to turn in & out of the driveway, I can't imagine using that garage would had worked too well. We ended up parking over at Pan Am Plaza, which was $18 for the night. The room itself was a bit small, but not too small. The furniture was really basic. Plain armless desk chair and basic desk, coffee maker with Starbucks pods, mini fridge that's a mini-bar stocked with overpriced food & drinks, etc. The bathroom was very small but adequate. I just wish the whole room had better lighting. Even the bathroom had pretty dim lights. It was nice though that there was light-up make-up mirror in the bathroom which helped the lack of lighting. It looked like there was a decent selection of movies, and a decent snack selection in the mini-bar. The vending machines had 20oz bottles of Pepsi products for $2 which isn't bad at all for a hotel in my opinion. Especially since there's isn't really anything too close where one can buy soda & snacks. The only odd thing that I had never experienced is that I had to have my room key to get into the vending area. The placed seemed to need some TLC. The pretty (should be shiny) stainless steel looking objects around the room, were pretty smeared & splotched with water spots. The shower head was pretty crusty with hard water gunk & wanted to spray every way except down. The shower was pretty odd, it had 2 shower heads. My husband was really impressed with the "Heavenly Bed," I thought it was all right, a bit too soft for my liking, but nothing like the foam that Marriott uses. The staff was great. Well except for when we checked out. When we received our bill under the door early in the morning we found a $4 charge for a bottle of water. The issue is, we hadn't drank the water, heck even if we had no one had been into the room to verify the whereabouts of the water. We called downstairs & asked for it to be taken off. When we went down to actually check out & drop off our keys, the front desk girl bordered on rude when we asked for a new bill that showed $0 in charges. She just kind of said nothing to us from that point, not like it took much to click that print button. But whatever, don't charge for your overpriced water, or raise the Aquafina price in the machine to a charge that wouldn't yield 2 bottles for the price of the 1 in the room. I don't think that this place is worth the going rate on the Westin site, or any travel site, or [--]. However, for $80 on Priceline for that busy weekend with the location of the hotel in relation to downtown it was great. I'd definitely stay again, a great option while downtown Indy. The parking isn't too bad I guess as long as you're willing to spend the few extra bucks to park at the hotel & don't plan on leaving in your car until you are checked out. Of the other 4 star options I do think that this is not the best, not the worst. I would prefer the Omni Severin (although it lacks real parking) over the Westin; however, I prefer the Westin to the Hyatt that's right on the other side of Simon.

Reviews.Title: “Security and Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: travel195409
Reviews.Content: When I arrived late (with a reservation) they indicated that they were overbooked (a common occurrence according to the clerk). But, it was the woman that walked into my room, screamed, and then left the hotel that was the most disturbing part. As you can see through these reviews, this hotel has a very mixed reputation, especially for a 4 star hotel. I understand overbooking as I am frequent traveler. Since there were no rooms in the area, this "4 star" hotel brought me a roll-away bed and put me in a meeting room / bar. Nice. It was two rooms with a large (open) double door in the middle. While I was, well, in the bathroom, someone came in the other side and started unpacking. It turns out the front desk gave a woman the room connected to mine without closing the large doors. She was so frightened she screamed. I immediately called down to the front desk and they were in no hurry to respond. I told them they needed to get there "now." The lady was very upset and left. And I was furious. I can’t imagine how I would have reacted if my wife had a similar experience. This morning the supervisor's response was not particularly concerned. His "yeah, sorry about that" attitude did not impress me. I will never stay there again and would caution others to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Westin”
Reviews.Author: lifeliver
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Indy Westin. Very clean, comfortable rooms with a modern aesthetic. Great location, friendly staff. Added bonus Starbucks in the lobby. The fitness center could use an update but does have nice machines and weights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: PGarcia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and got a 99.00 rate. This is a very lovely hotel, with upscale touches and atmosphere. Smack in the middle of downtown near the state capitol, it was a busy weekend when I stayed there, as a major convention was in town. I had trouble finding the entrance (by car) and with all the commotion, it was noisy outside. Inside, though, it was quiet and pleasant. The Westin is noted for their comfortable beds, and the Indianapolis location is no exception. I rested very well my two nights here. This hotel is convenient to the downtown restaurants and shops, and is across the street from the RCA Dome. One thing I wish it had was someplace other than a Starbucks concession to grab a quick snack. $3.00 for a drip coffee is a bit much but oh well...This hotel is also convenient to major interstates and attractions. All in all, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.......”
Reviews.Author: betucantdoitlikeme
Reviews.Content: I obtained my room through Hotwire for $100 for the night. An incredible rate for the Westin I originally thought. Once I arrived in my room, my opinion quickly changed. We've all heard the phrase "you get what you pay for." I definetly understood what that meant at the end of my stay at this property. The bathroom was small to put it nicely but was sufficient for our needs for the evening in spite of the fact that there was no fan for ventillation. Upon further inspection I noticed that there was a good 1/4 gap where the grout from the floor had separated from the tub. I dont know if this caused the carpet outside the bathroom to remain wet, but that carpet stayed damp from the time we showered until the time we departed. My room (901) was right next to the laundry room and from the start there were small problems that cause big headaches. The room had a stale cigarette smell. I immediately called the front desk and inquired why I was placed in a smoking room when I requested non-smoking. I was told that all rooms in the hotel were smoke free, but I could clearly tell my room had recently been switched over. The front desk girl told me someone would be up to deodorize the room....to my surprise this meant spraying a green liquid in what looked like a windex bottle. After seeing what the housekeepers would use, I told them not to worry about it. After a few minutes in the room I thought that if the thermostat was turned down the smell may be minimized. I turned the AC down to 65 degrees, and yet there was no change in room temperature. This was a HUGE problem since the heavenly bed has a down comforter on it and the temperature outside was in the low 80s.......it made the heavenly bed experience slightly less enjoyable. Moral of the story: If you get a room thru Hotwire dont expect much. They must save the crap rooms in the hotel for the people who get a deal. Just my two cents.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin! Loved the Heavenly Beds!”
Reviews.Author: reunitedOhio
Reviews.Content: Besides getting a great deal on Priceline, and an unbeatable location, this place was awesome. Make sure to ask the desk clerks about specials at Shula's Steak House, such as comp. appetizers, drinks, and messages! If you cant get a free parking meter on the weekend, you can have your parking ticket validated with any purchase at Shula's. We didnt need this, but were told by another guest. We grabbed a muffin and coffee at Starbucks, in the lobbyand saved our appetites for all the great restaurants that were in walking distance. The covered walkways would be great in the winter months when you might not want to be outside as much.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Be Back”
Reviews.Author: carztraveler
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review on this hotel last year shortly after it had been remodeled, and thought at that time that this was a good property. Well, I have changed my mind. Check in was difficult. I had booked a concierge floor room at $189.00 on a Saturday night. I am a Gold member. The check in desk was manned by a trainee who took quite a long time to check me in while the other clerk appeared to be on a personal call. I had notated in my original reservation quiet room and gold member. Apparently neither of these came through on the reservation. I expressed again, my desire for a quiet room, after a long day's drive. An hour after check in, I was surprised to hear people charging down the hall, repeatedly. After that I heard people outside my room on cell phones, along with other noise from the party. As other reviewers have noted, soundproofing is lacking at this hotel. It turned out that there was a convention party 2 doors down in the Presidential Suite, and it had been causing problems with noise all week! I called the front desk who sent security up. He said the party was "in order". Not so, if I could hear it in my room. I had to move all my stuff to another room, which was missing not only amenities, but furniture! The security guard finally offered to help with my luggage, but not until we were halfway to the new room. Last time I had room service here, it was expensive but great. This time it was expensive but a gooey ,salty mess. The rooms are remodeled, but not comfortable, except of course, for the Westin Bed which is always great. The bathroom was not as clean as it could have been, and quite small. All in all, I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but missing the finer points”
Reviews.Author: jatravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for one night on a business trip. I called ahead to ask for a good view and was told that I had a "fountain view." I actually looked out onto the side of the building and an industrial plant. When I entered my room there were pieces of something black on the floor which I picked up with a tissue (must not have been vacuumed). The room was well appointed and the furniture all looked pretty new. The bed was comfortable as advertised, but the sound proofing was lacking. I was woken up by the alarm clock in the room next to mine and could here that person's shower running loudly. The robe in the room was a nice touch, but was very scratchy. There were just little things that could have been nicer for the price. They charge for everything including internet access. Definitely don't move anything in the mini-bar. The latest check out that they will accommodate is 1 pm. They had a portable phone in the room which was a plus. We paid about $145 which was a group rate since we were meeting in the hotel. If I were paying for the room myself, I would only stay if I got it for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Indy, Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Indiana_Robert
Reviews.Content: Although connected to the Convention Center in Indy, this is NOT the place to choose. With advance reservations of more than a month, the reserved roll away was not available at the time of the visit. All paperwork showed it reserved. It did not exist. I called for any other option, I got 3 sheets. So for $224 I slept on the floor with 3 sheets and no blanket. On checkout, I found that the Westin does nothing to assist customers in parking. The lot says "reserved for Westin Guests" . The desk calls it public parking. The price of my stay was increased increased by 1/3 with parking costing $47 for 1 day. Not what I would expect, or have experieced from The Westin in the past. I stayed in Chicago and had a good and as expected stay. I think it is just the Indy Westin and I think it is because of poor managment and planning.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: AJMartin
Reviews.Content: Worth the visit. Beds were comfortable - Star Bucks in the lobby. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice... not Super”
Reviews.Author: beachtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in Indianapolis on business... and got the Westin for $100.00. ( Probably could have bid lower in retrospect but I was happy with that price.) The hotel is right downtown within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants, which was great. The lobby is showing it's age but they had some great scented candles that I liked. At check in, I asked for the room that over looks the state buildings that is shown on the website and the counter person told me that "none of the rooms " had that view. Very Strange. He did , however, give me my Starwood points for the stay, in spite of the fact that I'd booked on Priceline. Very nice. The room was small... just okay... very clean though, and the bed was comfy. This hotel is showing it's age in decor and in the bathroom fixtures. The turkey sandwich I had from room service was worth every cent of the $30.00 I paid, it was a great sandwich! I certainly wouldn't pay full fare for this hotel but I'd Priceline it again... and try for maybe $75.00.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: teacherwoman
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a one-night stay at the Westin Indianapolis. My husband and I went to Indy for a Colt's game. The Westin was fabulous. Parking was plentiful (but expensive at $23 per day), check-in was a breeze, and our room was very nice and clean. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in! I was a little concerned because they do allow pets, but I saw no evidence of a pet whatsoever. I loved the skywalk to the convention center and Circle Center Mall. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: NJ Family Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights recently at the Westin to attend a conference. Front desk - Very helpful and friendly (they had my package which I shipped earlier and delivered it for me, as well as giving me a Fed Ex that came) Parking/BellHop - Very helpful and friendly in arranging for taxis when needed, and storing luggage on moring of checkout until I finished with the conference Room - small but adequate, nice bed. Bathroom - very small as others have pointed out and only one showerhead worked, but good water pressure and plenty of hot water Room Service - ordered a cheeseburger one night which was great (properly cooked, hot when delivered, etc., fries were stil crispy) but that alone cost $25.00! Location - great/convenient for conference and centrally located in heart of City. Housekeeping - The worst! This is my main complaint. No service to my room after my first night. Second day - while they remade my bed, they did not empty the garbage cans, did not remove used glasses or provide fresh glasses, did not remove used towels left on other bed or provide fresh towels, did not replace toiletries. Definitely not worth $200/night. Will be sharing my review with the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “great location and room”
Reviews.Author: travelang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend get away. We pricelined it and after a few bad experiences with not knowing what we were getting until we had bought it, we were a bit worried. We thought that for what we paid, it couldn't be too disappointing because roadside hotels outside of town were not too much less for the weekend. We were pleasantly suprised at our excellent room location, the location of the hotel in relation to the attractions and the overall quality of the hotel. We have stayed in very nice and very pitiful hotels and this was one of our favorites. The bed is great! Look for street parking right near the hotel on the weekends. We parked all weekend (left the car and walked everywhere, which is easy to do) on the street for free (as opposed to the $23 a day in valet) and could see our car from the window of our room. I tried to come up with a negative point or two for balance, but I really can't think of one. The previous reviewers must have really high expectations, have stayed before the renovations or paid a lot more than we did (about $50 less than the current travelocity rate).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coriann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (in a suite) on the weekend of June 23rd. The bedroom had a beautiful view of the capitol. The bathroom is a little small, but very nice. The bedroom and sitting room were very spacious. And, yes, the beds are heavenly. As other reviewers noted, be careful of the mini bar. My husband opened it to see what they had to offer, but we did not take anything. We ended up being charged for 2 beers anyway ($5.90 each!). I called the front desk and they had the charges removed, but their mini bar policy is the harshest I've seen. Next time, I probably won't even open it. The hotel is in an ideal location - right across the street from the capitol and within easy walking distance to Monument Circle. I would stay at this hotel again. If it is your first time in Indy, I would highly recommend going to the Rathskeller - it is a German restaurant in a beautiful building with an amazing beer garden. It is a very short drive/cab ride from the hotel and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “fine accomodation”
Reviews.Author: forestgreen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend at the Westin in Indianapolis. We had plenty of hesitation staying at this hotel based on the reviews. I was relieved that our stay did not approach the negative experiences that others had. While we found some of the critiques to be well-based (small bathroom, ridiculous refridgerator policy), our overall experience was quite nice. The rooms were on the small side, but comfortable for our purposes ... but we don't require a lot of space when traveling. The Heavenly Bed lived up to expectations. And my most important concern after reading these reviews - a lack of hot water - was not the case at all during our stay. We took several showers with terrific water pressure and temperature. The staff were quite helpful and courteous. When we returned from a morning run, one of the valet staff offered us towels and bottled water.
